loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 41-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of seven children.

Kawthar is a tailor. She operates from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business such as needles, fabric and thread.

Kawthar is looking to increase her income so that she can finance her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as needles, thread and fabric

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thu supports her family by running an internet shop at her house. She started her business six months ago. She intends to take a loan to invest in her business by buying more computers and related appliances. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can set aside some savings for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy computers and related appliances for her internet shop.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 57-year-old widow from Marka, Amman, Jordan and the mother of one child.

Eman is selling clothes and accessories and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Eman is looking to expand her business and increase her income.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Eman's brother.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 23-year-old single man from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Yousef is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase metal scraps, since his business is to trade in metal scraps with his brother.

One aspiration of Yousef's is to improve his business so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to trade in metal scraps

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: BilA. is a 37-year-old married man from A. Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. BilA. provides services and maintenance work and he is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars to purchase products and machines needed for the business. An aspiration of BilA.'s is to purchase his own house.

loans.use: to purchase products and machines needed for the business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 35-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Sahar has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to do some new decorations for her salon in addition to purchasing new equipment.

Sahar is looking to add new lines for her salons such as skin treatment and renting wedding gowns.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and do some new decorations

loans.name: Nofah

texts.en:
Nofah is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nofah sells milk and other dairy products, which she makes at home. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase goats to make milk and other dairy products.

Nofah is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is a 23-year-old single lady from Madaba, Jordan.

Shereen is selling clothes from home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Shereen is looking to improve her family's living conditions and open a licensed shop for selling clothes instead of selling them from home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Farida 44 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Farida yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. 
7 let tomu nazad ona otkrila magazin kotoriy nazivayetsya  1001 meloch v kotoroy ona prodayot vse raznoye ( tapochki dlya doma, nojnicci, svechi,razniye kremi, brilok dlya kluchey i .d ). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye i noviye tovari kotoriye imeyut bolshuyu potrebnost  sredi pokupateley , dllya svayego magazina.
texts.en: Farida is 44 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Farida is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the Kalbadjar region and now lives with her husband and children in the Absheron region.  She opened a store, called "1001 Meloch," seven years ago and sells various merchandise (house slippers, scissors, candles, various lotions, key chains, etc.) there.  Farida currently needs 2000 AZN to buy necessary and new merchandise that is in high demand among customers for her store.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en: Sameeha is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Sameeha sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 900 Jordanian dinars to purchase more clothes for trading purposes. Sameeha is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en: Fahmi is a 58-year-old man from Baqa'a, Jordan. Fahmi has his own blacksmith in which he produce swords and knives. Fahmi is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase materials needed for his blacksmith so that he can improve his work. Fahmi is looking to improve his family's living conditions and employ his sons.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Rasmieh

texts.en:
Rasmieh is a 49-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Rasmieh is selling clothes and blankets from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes and blankets for trading purposes.

Rasmieh is looking to increase her family's living income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva, 49, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines, married to Clorito, an overseas contract worker, and the mother of four children. Her eldest is currently working as a call center agent; the second one is a nursing graduate; the third is in high school and her youngest is a special child who is now in Grade 4 studying in a special school for autistic children. While attending to her family, Minerva has also kept herself busy with her business to help her husband in sustaining daily expenses.

Minerva owns a variety store that sells groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other household commodities. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Minerva is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy more grocery items for her store. The more items displayed at the store the better, as they help to attract more customers and thus increase her profits, some of which she will use for her children's school expenses.

Minerva hopes that her business will continue to earn sufficient income for the needs of her family. She dreams of maintaining her youngest in the special school and continuing to fund her medicines. She hopes that her other children will have a stable life once they have their own families. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* group, as she learns a lot from the Bible, which strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Baruela

texts.en:
This is Baruela, 60, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Samson, an overseas contract worker. She is the mother of four children. All of her children are working. At her age, she still wants to keep herself busy, which is why she never stopped her business. 

Baruela owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more grocery items in order to have more inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. It will help to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in more profits. It will help her to save more money for her utility bills. 

Baruela hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that is sufficient enough for the needs of her family. She dreams that she can continue to help some of her extended family. She wants to share her blessings with those who are in need. She hopes that her children will have their own families someday. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to be more God-loving, and it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Jiael

texts.en:
This is Jiael, 26, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jumar, 34, a timekeeper. She is also the mother of one child who is now in grade IV. While attending to her husband and child, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband pay for the family's daily expenses. 

Jiael is a bayong maker. Bayong is a native bag in the Philippines made of rubberized plastic and hand woven. Jiael makes different sized bags depending on the request of clients in the market and malls. She also creates different designs such as square, triangle, and oblong. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw materials. With the Christmas season fast approaching, her numerous customers will place many orders for bayong to be used as fruit trays and vanity kits. 
  
Jiael hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that will provide for the needs of her family. She dreams that she can continue making bayong and attending to her family needs at the same time. She hopes that her family will remain simple and happy. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to have time in reading Bible verses and understand the sacrifices of our Christ Jesus. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep to expand his flock.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who lives in the Kongowea, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. He supplies water to neighborhoods. This idea came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. In addition to this, he also owns a motorcycle that he uses to transport people around the area. He is employed as a chef and has rental houses.

A loan of 40,000 KES will help John add more water kiosks. Although the high cost of living has reduced the disposable income of many customers needing transportation services, John intends to purchase more motorcycles in the future. He believes the income from the business will improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To add more water kiosks i.e pay fees/levy and intall selling points

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and three sons in his own house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His eldest son works for a private company in Ulaanbaatar, while the other sons attend college and school. His wife is unemployed; however, she helps her husband with his business. He had been working as either a driver or a welder for 20 years. He has been running his welding business successfully since 2005 and wants to expand it. He is a hardworking man who wishes to educate his children. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy iron for his business.

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs to expand his piggery.

loans.name: Lejani

texts.en:
This is Lejani, 33, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rony, a carpenter. She has one child. With her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lejani owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more grocery items, which will enable her to have more inventory on hand. The more items displayed at the store, the better. It helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in more profit. It will help her to save more money for the expenses of her child in school. 

Lejani hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that is sufficient enough for the needs of her family. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, tiene la edad  de 50 años de edad, está casada y vive actualmente con su esposo y su hija que es especial y su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar terneros para el engorde y su posterior venta. Ellos alquilan un  terreno apto para la explotación de este proyecto en las mejores condiciones, el pasto está en muy buenas condiciones. Ella quiere comprar estos animales para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado de la localidad para generar las mayores ganancias. Ella tiene como meta generar el máximo de las ganancias para salir adelante con su familia mejorar su calidad de vida y darle más facilidades a su hija que es especial. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Margarita is 50 years old, she is married and currently lives with her husband and her daughter who is special and her highest priority. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy calves for fattening for later sale. They rent land suitable for carrying out this project as it is in the best shape with the pasture in very good condition. She wants to buy these animals in order to fatten them and later sell them at the local market in order to generate higher profits. 

She has as her goal to earn the maximum profits in order for her family to prosper and to better their quality of life and make it easier for her daughter who is special. This is her first loan that she has received through FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has made getting the loan easier and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Nahomy

texts.es: Nahomy, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va compara los materiales para terminar su casa. Ella cuenta con su hogar ya construido pero le hace falta terminar unas partes de su hogar para darle más seguridad a sus bienes. Una de sus metas es darle el acabado definitivo a su hogar para contar con la seguridad de sus pertenecías dentro del hogar. Ella quiere darle a sus hijos un hogar con mejores condiciones de vivencia y así poder contar con el hogar propio para seguir adelante con su vida en el futuro.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nahomy, 26, is single and lives with her two children, who are her top priority. She will use the loan to buy materials to finish her house. She has built a home but still needs to finish some parts to make it more secure. One of her goals is to complete her home so that her belongings will be safe inside of it. She wants to give her children a home with better living conditions and to have her own home for the future. 

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has not had loans from other banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan easily and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en:
Amartuvshin is 23-years-old and lives alone in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 with his own car. 

He is an experienced young man who says"I love my job however due to my car condition, it is hard to maintain the car and my customers are not satisfied with my service."  

He has saving of 2,000,000 MNT however, it is not enough to renew his car. He is a sharp and hardworking young man who is requesting 1,500,000 to purchase a new car in order to run his business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, bags of cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Jose Juaquin

texts.es: José Joaquín, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casado y vive con su esposa e hijos. El con el crédito tiene pensado comprar terneros para el engorde. El cuanta con el terreno con pasto el cuidado de estos animales de la mejor forma y tenerlos en buena forma para su posterior venta. E l tiene como meta engordarlos a tiempo para su posterior venta y generar de ellos el máximo de ganancias para su bienestar familiar y mejorar su nivel económico cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Joaquín, age 56, is married and lives with his wife and children. He is going to use the loan to purchase calves for fattening. He has land with pasture. He takes good care of these animals and gets them in good condition for sale. His goal is to fatten them on schedule for a later sale in order to generate maximum earnings for his family’s welfare and improve their standard of living each day.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDESCOR. He hasn’t had any previous loans from state owned banks, but FUDESCOR has offered a loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase calves to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José Ignacio, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltero y vive con su  madre actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar materiales como papel, lapices, programas especiales de computo para diseñar y así realizar trabajos que tiene encargados para facilitar sus labores como diseñador grafico. El tiene como profesión realizar diseños gráficos, actualmente tiene unos encargos pendientes de entregar y le hacen falta los materiales mencionados para poder realizarlos por lo cual opto por el crédito. 

El tiene como meta prioritaria darle a su clientela el mayor y mejor resultado son sus trabajos dándole así una mejor calidad de los trabajos y mayor eficacia al hacerlos y a su vez generar más ganancias para su bienestar propio y de su mamá. 

Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Ignacio, age 22, is single and currently lives with his mother.  He is going to use the loan to purchase materials such as paper, pencils, and special design computer programs.  This well help him with his work as a graphic designer, as he currently has some pending assignments.  He lacks some materials for carrying these out, which is why he is applying for the loan.

His main goal is to give his clients the greatest and best results.  This leads them to give him better quality jobs.  Doing them with greater efficiency allows him to generate more earnings to improve his well-being, and that of his mother.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDESCOR.  He hasn’t had any previous loans from state owned banks, but FUDESCOR has offered a loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for his graphic design business.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married and has two daughters. One of them studies in a local school. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Zarina supports her husband financially by making threads from used clothes. She purchases the used clothes from the market (Landa Bazar) and then gets the thread out of those clothes and sells it in the market for a profit. She is also a very good housewife and performs her daily routine duties very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his auto rickshaw. This will allow him to save his business asset and also to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. He has operated his business for many years and Zarina is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: to repair her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products, like lotions and creams, among others.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 40 years of age, married and has a son who has just started attending school. She is a housewife and spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.

Her husband operates a sweetmeat selling business. The taste of his products is very good which helps him in attracting a good number of clients. Zahida also supports her husband by preparing sweetmeat for him. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase ingredients used in making sweetmeat of better taste and in larger quantity.

Zahida is hopeful that her husband’s income will be improved after the investment. He has operated his business for the past many years and Zahida has full confidence in him.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making better quality sweet-meat.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es: La Sra. Anacleta  la venta D. desayunos, te , café se dedica a esta actividad hace mas D. veinticinco años, cuenta con domicilio propio que se encuentra en la zona D. los Ladrilleros, necesita el crédito para la compra D. material D. construcción para  poder construir en su casa una cocina comedor, ya que esto le facilitara la elaboración D. comida rápida y así poder vender en su zona por las tardes y noches comida rápida, ya que vio por su zona la oportunidad D. poner un mini restaurante para que los trabajadores D. ladrillo tengan un buen ambiente donD. cenar o desayunar, la Sra. Anacleta es una persona muy amable y dinámica se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Anacleta sells breakfasts, tea, and coffee. She has been engaged in this business for more than twenty-five years years. She has her own home located in an area with brick makers.

She needs the loan in order to purchase construction material in order to build a kitchen in her house. This will help her in making fast food and, thus, enable her to sell fast food in her neighborhood in the afternoons and evenings. She sees an opportunity to put a small restaurant in her neighborhood since the brick-making workers would have a nice atmosphere in which to have dinner or breakfast. Sra. Anacleta is a very friendly and dynamic person. She is thankful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a kitchen.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casado y vive con su padres actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y en producción, la plantación este año necesita algunas mejorar para poder cosechar el café en mejores condiciones y dar más rendimiento en cantidad por lo cual le hará esta asistencia. El quiere seguir adelante con el proyecto cafetalero y es por eso que lo asistirá de esta forma. El tienen como meta aumentar la producción de café y generar el máximo de las ganancias para su bienestar familiar y el propio.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 25 years old, he is married and currently lives with his parents. 

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies in order to care for his coffee plantation. The land is already planted and in production. The plantation this year needs some improvement in order to be able to harvest the coffee in best conditions and to give more production in quantity which is why the assistance will help him. He wants to continue forward with the coffee-growing project and this is why in this way it will help him. 

His goal is to increase the production of coffee and to generate the maximum earnings for his welfare, and that of his family. It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans previously with state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has made the process easier and the rate of interest in much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to care for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: La señora Casilda esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive en casa de su suegro, ella se dedica a la confección de blusas para cholitas en su domicilio, la venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Cochabamba los días de feria  como son miércoles y sábados, entregando al por mayor a diferentes puestos del mercado pero también vende por menor, ella es una persona joven y emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, su sueño es el de poder tener un taller mas grande y poder confecciona una gran cantidad de blusas y poder venderlas en la ciudad de Oruro y Potosí, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tela para confección de blusas ya estas fechas de fin de año tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en: Casilda is married and has two small children. She lives in her father-in-law’s house. She sews blouses in her home for women who wear traditional dress. She makes her sales in the city of Cochabamba on market days, like Wednesday and Saturday, by turning in whole-sale orders to different market stalls, but she also sells items individually. She is a young and enterprising person with a desire to get ahead. Her dream is to have a larger workshop and to be able to sew a large number of blouses and sell them in the city of Oruro y Potosí. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric for blouses. There is a lot of demand at this time of year, at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing blouses

loans.name: Ibeth

texts.es: La señorita Ibeth vive en casa de sus padres los cuales tienen un anticrético en la zona de Villa Israel;  Ibeth se dedica a la venta de artículos para bebes,  la misma vende hace 2 años en el mismo puesto ubicado en un lugar estratégico, toda su familia se dedica al mismo negocio, en distintas tiendas, ella vende para poder estudiar en el futuro, ya que lo su sueño es terminar una carrera universitaria y poder ejercer su profesión, este dinero lo necesita para poder incrementar capital de trabajo con la compra de artículos para bebes al por mayor por las fiestas de fin de año, Ibeth es una persona joven con ganas de superación, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ibeth lives with her parents, who have an anticrético (pre-paid rental contract) house in the Villa Israel area. Ibeth sells products for babies, and she has been doing this for two years in a strategic location. Her whole family works in the same business at several stores.

Ibeth sells these products so she can study in the future, since her dream is to finish a university degree and have a career. She needs the money to increase her working capital by buying products for babies wholesale during the end of the year celebrations.

Ibeth is a young person who dreams of excelling. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to purchase baby products wholesale.

loans.name: Cayetana Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Cayetana Dominga es viuda, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica al tejido de servilletas, inició este trabajo ya que alguien le enseñó y lleva 22 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilo de diferentes colores para producir servilleta, espera en el futuro ver que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Cayetana, 54, is a widow with 2 children.  She didn’t have the chance to go to school but one of her children is still studying.  She weaves napkins, work that she first started 22 years ago when someone taught her how.

She is requesting a loan to buy different colored thread to make the napkins.  She hopes that her business will continue prospering in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave napkins

loans.name: Lucy Silvia

texts.es:
Lucy Silvia tiene 50 años vive en la urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de el Alto, cuenta con casa propia, cuenta con un ingreso por sueldo de vendedora con 18 años de experiencia laboral en una librería.
La cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro tiene un pequeño patrimonio en bienes muebles e inmueble.
El destino del crédito es para capital de inversión, refacción de vivienda y trámites de la misma en las oficinas de regulación de documentación de bienes inmuebles.
La cliente, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere mejorar su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con actitud de pago y emprendimiento en su vida personal y laboral.
texts.en:
Lucy Silvia is 50 years old. She lives in the Mercurio development in the city of El Alto. She has her own house and she has an income as a salesperson with 18 years of work experience in a book store.

Over time she has saved money and because of these small savings she has a small amount of personal property and real estate.

She will use the loan as capital to invest in house repairs and for some legal processes related to her house in the offices that regulate the documentation of real estate. 

The client, who wishes to improve her level of income, is responsible with payments and is enterprising in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to pay for legal processes related to the legalization of her house

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La señora Clotilde se dedica a la venta de desayunos,  tiene vivienda propia y puesto de venta propio, la señora se dedica al negocio en mas de 10 años, cuenta con una amplia clientela a la cual le sirve por las mañanas el desayuno, la señora necesita el dinero para poder compara en cantidad los insumos como azúcar y cereales para la elaboración de sus desayunos y el saldo para hacerle unas mejoras al puesto que tiene en el mercado es una cliente que muestra responsabilidad es muy amable y trabajadora. Agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Clotilde sells breakfasts. She has her own home and her own sales stall. Clotilde has had this business for more than ten years. She has a large customer base to whom she serves breakfast in the mornings.

She needs the money so she can buy breakfast-making supplies, like sugar and grains, in bulk. She will use the balance to make some improvements to the sales stall she has in the market.

Clotide is a customer who shows responsibility, and she is very friendly and hardworking. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies (sugar and grains).

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra vive en el barrio Juancho en vivienda familiar vive junto a su hijo pequeño y su esposo el cual trabaja en una empresa petrolera y se encuentra constantemente D. viaje, la cliente se dedica a la venta D. empanadas D. gigote, asaditos, pancitas, dicha actividad la realiza en una avenida muy concurrida, el crédito esta destinado para la comprar D. material D. construcción para la  refacción D. su vivienda, ya que la vivienda requiere D. colocado D. piso, gracias al esfuerzo D. la cliente y el apoyo D. su esposo ambos pudieron adquirir su lote D. terreno, el cual se encuentra en proceso D. saneamiento, el deseo D. la Sra. Sandra es el ver terminada su casita.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the Juancho neighborhood in a family house with her young son and her husband, who works at a petroleum company and is always traveling. She sells meat stew empanadas, grilled meats, and breads. She sells on an avenue that has a lot of traffic. 

The loan will be used to buy construction materials for her house, because the house needs to have the floor installed. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her husband, they were able to buy their own piece of land, which is currently in the process of being hooked up to water services. Sandra’s wish is to see her house finished.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí,  tiene  65 años de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos todos ellos son independientes. Ella inicia su negocio pulpería a  raíz que se retira de dar clases, era profesora daba clases a niños de escuela primaria pero al retirarse, sus ahorros los invirtió para comenzar  su negocio de pulpería  lleva 8 años con este negocio además no solo se dedica a la pulpería, elabora una de las comidas típicas y muy apetecidas características de la zona son las famosas rosquillas las cuales vende para poder ayudarse a mejorar sus ingresos. Ella requiere el préstamo para compra granos básicos, aceite, enlatados, dulces, snacks, verduras, frutas, productos de limpieza, también compra  maíz, queso que los principales ingredientes para elaborar sus deliciosas rosquillas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir y solventar parte delas necesidades que tiene su negocio, su meta próxima reparar poco a poco a infraestructura du casa que esta en deterioro
texts.en:
Ana is a native of Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí.  She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of four children, all of whom are independent.

She began her grocery store business as a result of retiring from teaching.  She was an elementary school teacher, but upon retiring she invested her savings to begin her grocery store business, which she has had for eight years.  She not only works in the store, she also makes one of the characteristic typical and very desired foods of the area, the famous "rosquillas" [a type of doughnut], which she sells to be able to help herself improve her income.

She needs the loan to buy staple goods, oil, canned goods, sweets, snacks, vegetables, fruits, and cleaning products, as well as corn and cheese, the main ingredients to make her delicious rosquillas.

With the loan Ana will be able to acquire and pay for part of the necessities for her business.  Her next goal is to repair little by little the infrastructure of her house, which is worn.

loans.use: to buy staple goods, oil, canned goods, sweets, snacks, vegetables, fruits, cleaning products, corn, and cheese.

loans.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Agustina es casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de delantales, inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Solicita un prestamos para la compra de telas típicas para elabora delantales y también la compra de hilos de diferente colores.
texts.en:
Floridna Agustina is married, is 36 years old, and finished primary school. She has 3 children, all of whom are studying. She makes dress aprons, which she started doing thanks to the support of a family member. She has 15 years of experience and has the support of her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy typical fabrics for making the dress aprons and also to buy threads of different colors.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who has a flour grinding and selling business. His shop is located in the market from where he operates his business. Due to fresh quality flour, he has a good number of clients in his community who purchase flour from him regularly. With the loan he will purchase wheat in larger a quantity which will allow him to sell more flour and increase his profits.

He has operated his business for the past many years and Samina is hopeful that an investment will help him earn more profits from his business. Samina is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them are studying in local school. She is confident about her husband's business success after a loan investment.

Note: The lady holding a passbook in her hand is Samina.

loans.use: to buy wheat for grinding and selling flour.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is an iron smith and makes iron boxes on order. He is an expert in his work and his iron boxes have good demand in the market.

With the loan he will purchase iron and tools that will allow him to make better quality boxes and increase his sales and profits.
He has vast experience in his business and Rashida is hopeful that the investment will be productive one for him.

She is a housewife and performs her household duties very well. She is 29-years-old and has 3 children, 1 one them studies while the others are not of school age yet.

Note:- The lady holding passbook called Asasah passbook is Rashida

loans.use: to buy iron for making iron boxes.

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: En uno de los barrios mas pintorescos de la ciudad de León, donde las ventas ambulantes , la pulperías y venta de frutas vegetales son parte de la actividad diaria y cotidiana de sus habitantes , es donde vive doña Lidia , una mujer humilde llena de sueños y metas , es comerciante desde hace 20 años , tiene 47 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 26, 23 y 18 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos estudio administración de empresas, el segundo es mecánico industrial y el tercero esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria  y fue con mucho esfuerzo y duro trabajo saliendo todo los días  con su humilde mesa y una pesa vender verduras y carne por libras en las afueras de su casa  que ella logro preparar a sus dos hijos mayores. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras  y carne para vender y surtir su negocio de estos productos para  vender  y ofrecer a sus clientes que a diario la visitan en busca de estos productos. Por lo pronto su meta principal es terminar de preparar a su hijo menor para que estudie una carrera universitaria y otra meta que tienes es comprar un freezer para almacenar carne y una mesa grande de adera para colocr sus productos pues la mes que tiene esta muy vieja y algo deteriorada.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in one of the most picturesque neighborhoods of León, where street sellers, small grocery stores, and fruit and vegetable sellers are part of daily life. She is a humble woman full of dreams and goals. She has been a seller for 20 years. She is 47 years old and has three children who are 26, 23, and 18 years old. The oldest of her children studied business administration, the second is an industrial mechanic, and third is in his third year of secondary school. It was through a lot of effort and hard work, going to work every day with her humble table and a scale to sell vegetables and meat by the pound outside her house, that she was able to put her two older children through school.

She needs a loan to buy vegetables and meat to sell and stock her business with these products so she can offer them to her customers, who come to her each day looking for them. In the short term, her main goal is to finish putting her youngest son through school so he can study in the university. Antoher goal she has is to buy a freezer to store meat and a large wooden table to put her products on because the table she has is very old and deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat for resale

loans.name: Juliana Paula

texts.es:
La señora Juliana Paula es casada, tiene 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la sastrería la confección de manteles de diferentes diseños, inicio este trabajo como operaria y lleva 5 años de experiencia.

solicita un prestamos para utilizarlo para comprar telas de diferentes colores, para tener mas producción, espera en el futuro ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Juliana Paula, 55, is married and has two children.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She works as a tailor making cloths of different designs.  She started this work as a machinist and has five years of experience.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fabrics in different colors to produce more. She hopes in the future that her shop will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make shirts.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a widow. After the death of her husband, life became very difficult for her but she never lost hope. She raised her children with great effort. Now her children have grown and taken over the financial responsibility of the family.
Her eldest son runs a grocery store while two of remaining five also work. Her three younger children are getting their education.
Kosar remains at home and does her household responsibilities.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to stock a larger supply of items such as spices, sugar and cooking oil in his grocery store. This will allow him to fulfill his clients' orders and increase his profits.
He has been operating his business for the past many years and Kosar is very hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.
Note: - The lady holding the pass book in the picture is Kosar

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, cooking oil and other grocery items.

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santos Margarita  es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a comercio, a la venta de ropa típica para damas, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de una de sus amistades, y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería consistente en en cortes, suéteres, güipíles, fajas, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is married, is 53 years old, and she finished the 6 years of primary school. She works in sales of traditional clothing for women. She started this business thanks to the support of one of her friends. She has 3 years of experience. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise that consists of skirts, sweaters, embroidered blouses, cloth belts, etc. She expects to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old housewife and performs her household duties. She is a great mother and raises her children very well. Both of her children are studying in a local school.
She also provides full support to her husband in his animal business. She takes care of the animals and keeps their living space clean.
Her husband wants a loan for the expansion of his business. With the loan he will buy goats and sheep and sell them after they become healthy and grown.
He has operated his business for the past many years. Razia is very hopeful that the loan will help her husband’s business to become more successful.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for his animal business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan Jose es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para damas, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa quie la lo apoya.

solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, consistente en suéteres, blusas, fajas, cortes, etc. espera en el futuro tener un local de venta y negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Juan Jose is 30 years old, married, and attended four years of primary school.  He works selling traditional clothing for women.  He started this business himself and has five years of experience.  His wife helps him with the business.

He is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise, which includes sweaters, shirts, belts, and skirts.  He hopes in the future to have a shop to sell his merchandise and make his business larger.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his traditional clothing sales business.

loans.name: Alan Augusto

texts.es:
Alan tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de su madre quien reside en la región Piura.  Reside en el Caserío Guaraguaos Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Alan vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y  cuenta con servicio de luz.

Alan se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 3 años, además se dedica a la agricultura, trabajando con su hermano mayor, sembrando marigol y maíz.  Paralelamente es peón agrícola en los fundos del caserío

Alan desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y aves con la finalidad de lograr mejor tamaño y peso en menos tiempo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alan is 27 years old. He is single and doesn’t have children. He lives in the house of his mother, who lives in the Piura region, in the small town of Guaraguaos Alto, in the district of Tambogrande, which is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. Alan lives in the rural area of this district and has electricity.

Alan raises small livestock (sheep, pigs, and domestic fowl). When they reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market. He has been in this business for 3 years. He also works in agriculture, working with his older brother to plant sunflowers and corn. He also works as an agricultural laborer on farms in the town.

Alan wants to buy feed for fattening his livestock and fowl with the goal of getting them to a better size and weight in less time. For this reason he has decided it would be a good idea to obtain a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa so he can achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten his livestock

loans.name: Shaista's Group

texts.en:
Shaista is a housewife. She spends her time staying at home and fulfilling her household responsibilities.
She is very supportive and performs her routine tasks very well.
She has given birth to four children, three of whom are studying while youngest one stays at home.
Her husband sells shoes. His shop is in the market -- he sells good quality shoes at low prices.
Shaista has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s shoe business. With the loan he will purchase shoes of greater variety and in larger quantity that will allow him to make more sales and profits.
He is very experienced in his business and has been running it for the past many years. Shaista is very confident about the success of her husband’s business as a result on this investment.
Note: In the picture, the lady who has raised her hand is Shaista.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Zobeida

texts.es:
Zobeida tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo menor a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pedregal Bajo del Distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Zobeida vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y aún no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Zobeida se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, teniendo actualmente 25 gallinas y 10 patos, los cuales engorda para venderlos en mercado local y además se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un colegio cercano a su domicilio, atendiendo todos los días de la semana, lo cual le genera ingresos diarios para cubrir sus gastos. Asimismo su padre la apoya en las actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar con sus padres, quienes también apoyan para el crecimiento de su negocio. 

Zobeida desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus aves de corral y compra de mercadería, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa, para con ello lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Zobeida is 32 years old and a single mother of one child.  She lives in her parent's house, which is located in the village of Pedregal Bajo in the district of Tambogrande, about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.  Zobeida lives in the rural part of the district that does not have utilities.  

Zobeida works raising poultry.  She currently has 25 hens and 10 ducks, which she is fattening to sell in the local market.  She also sells sweets at the school near her home every day, which generates daily income to meet her expenses.  Additionally, her father supports the activities she does.  She has a good family relationship with her parents, who also support the growth of her business.

Zobeida wants to purchase balanced feed to fatten her poultry and purchase merchandise.  This investment will allow her to continue growing and improve her quality of life.  In order to achieve this goal, she has requested a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jhony Manuel

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está terminando de construir.  La casa está ubicada en el Caserío San Eduardo Bajo Distrito de Tambogrande ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Jhony vive en la parte rural de este distrito y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de luz.

Jhony se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, teniendo 20 cabezas y 15 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en mercado local, además cuenta con 0.50 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene limón en producción, generándole ingresos semanales para cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias.

Jhony desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de ovinos y aves de corral, esto para alimentarlos y alcanzar rápidamente un nivel de desarrollo aceptable para su ganado y posteriormente venderlo. Es por ello que ha considerado conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jhony, 37, is single with no children.  He lives in his own home, which he is finishing building.  The house is located in the San Eduardo Bajo community in the district of Tambogrande, located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque.  Jhony lives in the rural part of this district and only has basic electric service.

Jhony works raising sheep and poultry, having 20 head and 15 turkeys, which he raises and fattens to sell later in the local market.  He also has 0.5 hectares of land that his father handed down to him, where he grows lemons, generating weekly income to cover his loan obligations.

Jhony wants to buy balanced feed to fatten sheep and poultry, to feed them so they quickly reach an acceptable level of growth for his livestock, to later sell.  This is why he has considered it advisable to get a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will allow him to continue growing and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his livestock.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Las Mercedes del Distrito D. TambogranD., perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque. Bertha vive en zona rural D. este distrito y aún  no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Bertha se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, como ovinos y aves D. corral, teniendo actualmente 25 cabezas y 10 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego sacrificarlos y/o venderlos en su caserío o comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposo trabaja en un fundo agrícola como peón estable, y con estos ingresos pueden solventar los gastos familiares.

Bertha desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. su ganado ovino y aves D. corral, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo y así mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is 50 years old; she is married and has one son. She is from the village of Las Mercedes in the TambogranD. district of the Piura Region. This town is about four hours from the city of Chiclayo. Bertha lives in a rural area that still doesn't have basic services.

Bertha works raising small livestock like sheep and poultry. She currently has 25 head of sheep and 10 turkeys, which she has raised and fattened to later sell them in her village or at a market nearby. Her husband works as a farm laborer, and with this income they can cover their family expenses.

Bertha wants to proviD. a balanced diet to fatten her sheep and poultry, so she has applied for a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This loan will help her continue to grow her business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase feed for small livestock

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her grocery store which she operates from her home. She sells household items like sugar and cooking oil.
With the loan she will buy grocery items such as sugar and cooking oil in bulk. This will allow her to fulfill her clients' orders and increase her profits.
She has operated her business for the past many years and is very confident about her success after the loan investment.
Her husband is a government servant and earns a reasonable income.
She has given birth to four children, all of whom study in a local school.
Besides her business, Nasreen also performs her household duties very actively.
Note: In the picture, the lady who has the passbook in her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and other grocery items.

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es:
Alberto hombre trabajador, tiene su pequeño negocio, es conductor de su propio vehículo ofreciendo su servicio en la vía pública como taxista.  Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda colocándole las ventanas y puertas así obtuvo seguridad para su familia.
Se le ha presentado dificultades el vehículo descompuso ocasionado perdidas económicas, requiriendo realizarle revisión completa y cambios de repuestos. Con esta nueva solicitud de préstamo comprar: frenos, amortiguadores, aspírales, rotula, maniquea, bumper delantero, luces vía delanteros, laterales, focos, luces de stop, retroceso, entre otros repuestos del auto para cambiar la carrocería, la dirección, suspensión, rodamiento, sistema de frenos, el sistema eléctrico y el motor que tiene filtraciones de aceite siendo perdidas notables. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo ya que le ha permitido mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto is a hard-working man who has a small business.  He drives his own car providing service on the streets as a taxi-driver.  With his previous loan, he was able to improve his home's infrastructure by putting in windows and doors to ensure security for his family.

He has had some difficulties as his car has broken down causing him to lose money.  It needs to completely overhauled and have parts replaced.  With this new loan request, he will buy: brakes, dampers, coils, brackets, front bumper, parking lights, side-lights, head-lights, and stop-lights, among other automotive spare parts, so that he can change the bodywork, steering, suspension, bearings, brake system, electrical system and the motor which is leaking significant amounts of oil.

He is grateful to the lending institution for the help, as it has allowed him to improve his standard of living little by little.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric for making polo-shirts.

loans.name: Jose Florencio

texts.es:
El señor Jose Florencio es casado, tiene 29 años de edad, esta especializado en la reparación y mantenimiento de vehiculos, tiene 5 años de experiencia, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de útiles para mecánica, espera en el futuro tener su empresa bien posicionado para el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Florencio is married, and is 29 years old.  He specializes in auto repair and maintenance, in which he has five years of experience.  He has two children, one of whom is in school.

He is requesting a loan which he will use to purchase mechanic's tools.  He hopes in the future that his business will be well positioned to serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mariela comerciante tiene una pulpería y a su vez con el apoyo de su mami  tiene una comideria desde hace un tiempo siendo su fuente de ingreso. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. 
Con el préstamo que solicitad comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro, piedras cantera, tablones de maderas, estribu, alambre de amarre, cerámica entre otros materiales que se requieren para la construcción del muro del costado derecho y colocar en el piso cerámica. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a que sus planes y proyectos sean una realidad. Mejorando la presentación del negocio obtendrá nuevas clientela así como mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Mariela works in retail; she has a general store and also runs a diner with the help of her mom, which has been a source of income for some time.  Her plans are to improve her home's infrastructure.

With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, quarry stones, wooden boards, braces, wire-ties, and tiles among other materials that she needs to build a wall on the right side, and lay a tile floor.

She is grateful to the financing institution for the support in making her plans become a reality.  Improving the look of her business will help her gain new customers as well as giving her greater security.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Camila mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, comerciante tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos y variedades que con sus propios esfuerzos ha alcanzado realizar mejoras en su forma de vida y mediante los prestamos ha sido de apoyo para lograr sus metas. Invirtió en el ciclo anterior en la compra de productos dejándole ganancia utilizada en reparaciones de su vivienda. Con este nuevo préstamo comprar en mayores cantidades y variedad de productos como: perfumes, colonias para niños, cremas de manos, pintura de labios, cejas, pestañas, blusas de damas, camisas para caballeros, pantalones de vestir, jeans entre otros productos que para estos tiempos festivos se vende en mayores proporciones. Obteniendo de esta inversión mayores ganancias, mejorando su nivel de vida y generándole fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Camila, a hard-working and entrepreneurial businesswoman, has her business selling cosmetics and various types of merchandise.  With her own effort she has managed to make improvements in her lifestyle, and the loans have been support for realizing her goals.  In the previous loan cycle she invested in buying products, giving her profits that she used repairing her house.

With this new loan she will buy wholesale a variety of products, such as perfume, cologne for children, hand cream, lipstick, eyebrow pencil, mascara, women's blouses, men's shirts, dress pants, and jeans, among other products that for these holidays are sold in greater numbers.  From this loan she will get greater profits, improving her quality of life and generating work for her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Lorena es socia del banco comunal Sentimientos, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, es la tercera ciudad  más importante del País, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, es una ciudad de gente amable y de un corazón muy cálido.

Doña Lorena tiene 32 años, es madre soletera de 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar. 

La Señora. Lorena es empleada privada, labora en horarios rotativos y también hace 3 años trabaja en la venta de productos Yanbal.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para surtir más su negocio.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorena is a member of the Communal Bank “Sentimientos” (Feelings). She lives in the neighborhood of Uncovia in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by four rivers. It is the third largest city in Ecuador. The people have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. Cuenca is a city full of friendly people who possess very warm hearts.

Doña Lorena is 32 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 12 and 6). Her first child is in high school and her younger child attends an elementary school in the city. She lives at her parents’ home and shares in the household expenses.

Sra. Lorena is employed at a private company and works on rotating shifts. She has also been selling Yanbal products for the past three years.

Lorena has been with her Communal Bank for three years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets so that she can have more inventory in her business. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Sentimientos, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, es la tercera ciudad más importante del País, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, es una ciudad de gente amable y de un corazón muy cálido.

La Señora. Narcisa tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, dos de sus hijos trabajan para sus gastos personales y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Narcisa se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que realiza hace 20 años, trabaja solo tres días a la semana y sin un horario fijo, los demás días se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y al hogar.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para comprar blusas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa de niños para  surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  tener un local para vender comida rápida.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Sentimientos” (Feelings). She lives in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by four rivers. It is the third largest city in Ecuador. The people have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. Cuenca is a city full of friendly people who possess very warm hearts.

Sra. Narcisa is 45 years old and a single mother with six children (ages 25, 23, 20, 18, 16, and 12). Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Two of her children work in order to cover their personal expenses. Her three youngest children attend a high school in the city. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Narcisa has been selling all types of clothing for 20 years. She only works three days a week and does not have a set schedule. On the other days, she takes care of her children and her home.

This is her second loan with the Communal Bank. She will invest the money in the purchase of blouses, shirts, trousers, and children’s clothing so that she can restock with more merchandise. Her goal is to have a shop where she can sell fast food.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, trousers, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca,  a esta ciudad la hace hermosa su mezcla pintoresca entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus lugares con abundante naturaleza, su gente quienes son de un corazón cálido y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ana tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 25 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en una colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio familiar, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Ana se dedica al comercio ya que cuanta con una tienda en un mercado de la ciudad donde vende variedad de productos como aceite, vinagre, granos secos y otros productos de primera necesidad, labora en el negocio hace 26 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, granos secos, legumbres, etc. para crecer más en su tienda.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca. The beauty of this picturesque city is a result of blending the colonial with the modern. There is abundant natural beauty. The people possess warm hearts and have been able to maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Ana is 48 years old, married, and has three children (ages 26, 25, and 16). Her first two children are married and live independently, while her youngest daughter attends high school in the city. Her husband helps with the family business. Ana and her family own the house that they live in as a result of the sacrifices her husband made through his work.

Sra. Ana is a merchant and has a shop at the city market. She sells a variety of products such as oil, vinegar, dried grains, and other basic necessities. Ana has been in this business for 26 years and works Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 6pm. She has been with her Communal Bank for 10 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of basic necessities, dried grains, legumes, and other products so that her business can grow even more. Her dream is to not be in debt.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, dried grains, legumes, and other products.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad la hace hermosa su mezcla pintoresca entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus lugares con abundante naturaleza, su gente quienes son de un corazón cálido y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 28, 27 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son solteros y viven independientes y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio familiar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa trabaja desde su casa, se dedica con su esposo a elaborar tortas y pan, también tienen una tienda en donde trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, levadura, azúcar y otros víveres para su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in the central section of the city of Cuenca. The beauty of this picturesque city is a result of blending the colonial with the modern. There is abundant natural beauty. The people possess warm hearts and have been able to maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Rosa is 42 years old, married, and has three children (ages 28, 27, and 9). Her two older children are single and live independently, while her youngest child attends an elementary school in the city. Her husband helps with the family business. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Rosa works from home. She and her husband produce cakes and bread. They also have a shop where they work Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 10pm. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after she was invited to join by a neighbor. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients for her business. Her goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Llacao que se encuentra situada al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su nombre se origina del vocablo quichua “llacar” que significa "el desprendimiento del choclo", y del sustantivo “cau” que significa "choclos a punto de desmembrarse". Llacao significa: desprendimiento de choclos en tiempo de cosecha.  Su gente es amable y se dedica a  la elaboración de artesanías como: sombreros de paja toquilla, cestería y cerámica decorativa.

Doña María tiene 61 años, es madre soltera  de 2 hijos que son mayores de edad y  casados,  uno vive independiente y su hija vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que vive es de propiedad.

La Señora. María labora en un mercado de la ciudad, en donde se dedica a la venta de granos secos, lleva 30 años en este negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin ningún horario. En su casa tambien se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos. 

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es salir adelante y crecer más en sus negocios.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Sociedad 12 de Abril” communal bank.  She lives around Llacao Parish located in northeast Cuenca.  Its name comes from the Quechua word “llacar” which means “releasing corn” and the word “cau” which means “corn about to be separated.”  Llacao, then, means the removal of corn at the time of harvesting.  Its residents are kind and work making crafts like straw hats, basketry and decorative ceramics.

María is 61 years old and a single mother of 2 children who are married adults now.  One of them lives independently and her daughter lives with her and shares household expenses with her; the house she lives in is her property.

María works in a market in her city selling dry grains; she’s been in this business 30 years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  At home, she raises pigs and chickens to sell.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy pigs and pig feed.  Her goal is to get ahead and to grow more with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: 2 De Noviembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 15 De Abril en la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente honesta y trabajadora con una gran variedad  en su gastronomía y con un clima variable y agradable, cada 15 días se reúnen  los socios  del Banco Comunal 2 De Noviembre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a don Sergio, tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciado y tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores y dos de 16 y 14 años de edad que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos viven con él.
 
El se dedica al comercio, vende remedios y productos naturales, recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y también se desplaza a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, trabaja todos los días ya que según él, si no trabaja como mantiene a sus hijos, sus productos los compra en un local de la ciudad y vende productos tanto nacionales como del extranjeros, lleva más de 23 años en este negocio y  tiene mucha clientela que siempre le compran ya que sus productos son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar remedios y productos naturales. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro. 

La señora con una camiseta turquesa que aparece en la foto en la última fila, arimada a una puerta negra es familiar de una de las socias y no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
In the April 15th neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, one can find honest and hardworking people, a wide variety of cuisines, and a variable and pleasant climate. The members of the November 2nd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. They engage in different businesses in retail, services, and other sectors. The members have joined forces so that they can access the benefits provided by Fundación ESPOIR. This is their first loan cycle as a Communal Bank and they hope to do well so that they can move forward with the organization.

It is here that one can meet Don Sergio. He is 44 years old, divorced, and has four children. Two of them are grown and the other two (ages 16 and 14) attend high school. All of his children live with him.

Sergio is a merchant who sells remedies and natural products. He travels around the city offering his products. Sergio also visits other cities in order to make sales. He works every day and, according to him, would not able to support his children if he was not working. His products are purchased at a store in the city and then sold nationally and abroad. Sergio has been in business for more than 23 years and has many customers who always buy his products because they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy remedies and natural products. Sergio is in his first loan cycle with the Communal Bank and he enjoys the speed by which he was able to secure the loan. His dream is to have a large shop in the downtown area.

The woman in the turquoise shirt and standing in the back row of the photograph is a relative of one of the members. She does not belong to the group.

loans.use: to buy remedies and natural products.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en: Alaa' is a 29-year-old young man who is married with one son. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary in addition to his work in agriculture. Alaa' wants to increase his profit from selling olive products by purchasing more olive seedlings. However, he doesn't have the money to buy the olive seedlings, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, he will purchase the olive seedlings and maximize his sales of olive products to increase his income. Then he will be able to offer better living conditions to his family. Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase olive seedlings.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en: Ghanem is 32-year-old young man. He is married, but does not yet have any children. He is a worker with a decent salary. Ghanem wants to make some repairs to his house, such as installing tiles and changing windows and doors, but he doesn't have the money for it. He would like to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ghanem gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the necessary repairs to his house. This will improve his house and enable him to live with his family in better living conditions. Ghanem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Gaza. Three years ago, Mohammad opened his own mini supermarket. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy products for his store which will increase his income. This will help Mohammad and his mother to live a better life, financially.

loans.use: to buy products for his store.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en: Tahreer is a 37-year-old young woman who is married with three sons and two daughters. She is an employee with a decent salary in addition to having a good source of income from her grocery store. Tahreer wants to expand her grocery store by opening a new section for toys.
