She would like to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Tahreer gets the loan, she will be able to open a new section for toys. She needs to purchase the toys and install the shelves and lighting. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her sales and income and live in a better condition with her family. Tahreer is photographed in her store.

loans.use: To open a new toy section in her store.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a 26-year-old young man who is married with one daughter. He works on a machine which polishes tiles. He earns a good income from his business, but he wants to purchase a new machine to improve his work and increase his income. He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Firas gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new tile polishing machine. This will enable him to compete with others in the same field and provide high quality services to his customers. He hopes that he will be able to increase his income and provide better living conditions for his family. Firas is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a new tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA. is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of two children.

NawA. is selling weddiing gowns and engagement dresses. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more gowns and dresses to sell.

NawA. is looking to open a shop from where she can sell her dresses instead of selling them from home. She is also looking to save some amount of money to finance her daughters' education in tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase wedding gowns to sell

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza. He owns a cell phone store and hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store. He also hopes that once he does, this will bring in more customers and increase his income. Once his income is higher, he anticipates that he, his wife, and seven children will live a better life.

loans.use: to increase the size of his store.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 36-year-old married man from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a father of six children.

Haitham is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase furniture and a refrigerator.

Haitham is looking to do painting on his house and purchase his own car.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and a refrigerator

loans.name: Mo'ataz

texts.en: Mo'ataz is a 33-year-old married man from Baqa'a, Jordan. He is the father of three children. Mo'ataz has an aluminum metal shop and he is requesting a loan of 700 Jordanian dinars to purchase a stapling machine and do maintenance on the metal cutting machine. An aspiration of Mo'ataz is to expand his business by leaving his partners and opening a totally owned shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stapling machine and do maintenace on the metal cutting machine

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: AmA. is a 49-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She is the mother of two children. AmA. is making candies from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase molds to make new shapes of candies. AmA. is looking to open a shop for her candies.

loans.use: to purchase candy molds

loans.name: Najiah

texts.en:
Najiah is a 56 year old married woman with five sons.  She works in agriculture and earns a low income.  Najiah also raises laying hens and sells their products. 

Najiah wants to increase her income and would like to purchase more laying hens, cages and food.  But the amount of money she has isn't enough to cover the cost.  She needs a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

Increased sales and profits will enable Najiah to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more laying hens, cages and food.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 27-year-old married woman, who has three children. Her husband works for the security department in Al Karak. Walaa opened a small shop to sell home products and items, mostly kitchen tools such as cups, plates, trays, etc. It has been six years now since she started, and her business is running smoothly. 

Now Walaa has applied for a loan to add more items to her store, so she can cover most home products needed besides kitchen items.

loans.use: to add more items to her home products store

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en: Kamleh is a 44-year-old mother of seven children. Because Kamleh is a conservative person, her son Fadi has agreed to appear in the photo instead. Kamleh's husband works at an institution for taking care of orphans. Because they have a big family, Kamleh opened a medium-sized food store in the area to help with their family’s finances. Kamleh and her son Fadi take shifts working in the store. Now Kamleh wants to legally register her store and buy more food products. That’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to legally register her store and buy more food products

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 28-year-old single man, who opened a small food store four years ago. From the profit that he makes from the store, he is planning to marry and have his own family. To be able to do that, and to be well prepared to start a new family, Alaa sees that he should improve his food store by adding more products to make more profit. He also wants to build a storage for the store. In order to achieve that, he has applied for a loan to start the store improvement phase step-by-step.

loans.use: to add more food products and build a storage room for the store

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 26-year-old housewife, who started a small home-based business selling kitchen tools and items 3 months ago. She wants to help her husband, who works in the Jordanian military, and also to fill her free time at home. Her customer base has grown by word of mouth between her friends and family to include neighbors and their friends. To be able to serve these customers, Sanaa has now applied for a loan to buy more items that are missing from the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy more items that are missing from the home products she sells

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, 31 years old, is married and has two daughters and one son.

Abeer opened a small day care a few years ago to have another source of income, but as that was not enough for her, she started to make creative baskets and embroidered table covers in her free time at home, then turned it into another small business but based at home.

Now Abeer has applied for a loan to buy more embroidery materials such as fabric, etc. to expand more in this field of business. In the future Abeer wants to open a special workshop for such business and employ more creative people.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery materials such as fabric.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 32-year-old housewife; she has four children from her husband who works as a police officer.

A year ago, Raghda started a small home-based business selling clothes, mostly for kids. Now she wants to add more products to be able to serve the older generation and have more variety.

In the future Raghda wants to have her own clothes store.

loans.use: to add more clothing products.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old woman who works along with her husband, Emad, in a tailoring shop that she owns. They have two daughters and one son.

Both Amal and her husband have been working in the shop for the last 7 years, and are dependent on it as their income source. 

Now Amal has applied for a loan to fix the interior decoration and arrangement to be more flexible for them to work in; she also wants to buy more fabric and material.

Since Amal is a conservative person, her husband Emad has agreed to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to improve the interior decoration and to buy more fabric and material.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 39-year-old divorced woman who has rented a small shop in a complex in Al Baqaa to open a small accessories shop so she can support herself financially.

It has been almost 5 months since she started her business, and it is  running smoothly since there are a good number of visitors to that complex who have become her customers.

Now Asmaa has applied for this loan in order to add more variety of accessories to satisfy most of the ladies' tastes.

loans.use: to add more variety of accessories.

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 53-year-old woman, who has three sons and one daughter; one of the sons has got married and started his own family. 

Anaam has been working beside her husband making sweets and pastries for the last 5 years using her husband's experience in making sweets to be able to support their family and children.

Now Anaam and her husband want to increase their productivity by making larger amounts of sweets since at this time of the year, the holiday season, the number of orders gets high. So to be able to serve all the customers, Anaam has applied for a loan to buy more ingredients that are needed to make those sweets and pastries.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients that are needed to make sweets and pastries.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab is a young man of 19 who did not finish high school and has been working in the market selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. A year ago he managed to own his own kiosk, a well-known place in the market, where people come to buy their fresh fruits and vegetables.

Because there has been a lot of demand for the fruit that he sells, Ehab found that he need to buy a larger quantity than what he used to have so he can fulfill the customers' demand, and that’s why he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en:
Nedaa is a supportive wife who is married to Mohammad. Mohammad works in one of the Jordanian universities; he also has artistic talent which is what he does in his free time and based on his orders.

Nedaa now has applied for a loan in order to support her husband and open a small painting workshop for him to paint pictures to sell and make that their second source of income.

Because Nedaa is a conservative person, she has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To help her husband open a small painting workshop.

loans.name: Tamador

texts.en:
Tamador is a 30-year-old mother of one child. They live in a rented house with her husband who works as an optics specialist.

Tamador decided a year ago to start a small home-based business selling children's clothes, and through this year the number of her customers has grown therefore she was able to bring in more clothes to sell.

Now Tamador wants to buy a larger quantity of stock so she can make more profit and one day open a separate clothes store in their area. 

Because Tamador is a conservative person, her sister Israa has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy larger quantity of clothes to stock.

loans.name: Jajatypeka Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Jajatypeka Oñondivepa es un comité de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 12 mujeres, las cuales se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de ellas es la señora Zoraida, ella tiene una carnicería. Comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, tratando de brindar siempre buenos productos a sus clientes. Por medio de su negocio ella está ayudando a su familia a salir adelante y que tengan una vida digna.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más cantidad para cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Jajatypeka Oñondivepa” is a committee from the city of Santaní that consists of 12 women. They have enjoyed working with the Women’s Committee Program of Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Sra. Zoraida, who owns a butcher shop. She says that she works every day, starting in the early morning hours, and always strives to provide good products to her customers. Through her business, Zoraida has been able to help her family move forward so that they can have a decent life.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat so that she will be stocked and have more inventory to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat that she can sell.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó con 11 amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. Santaní. Ellas tienen el objetivo D. trabajar juntas y por medio D. ese trabajo salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias e hijos, dándoles un estilo D. vida digno y decoroso.
Maria trabaja en la cría y venta D. cerdos, trabajo que le ayuda a mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad D. animales, los cuales cría y luego venD.. Dice que tiene buena clientela y que gracias a eso tiene buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su microempresa. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, ya que su trabajo no es nada fácil.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. Kiva para la compra D. cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta.  Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group consists of 11 friends and neighbors in the city of Santaní.  Their goal is to work together and by means of that work get ahead and help their families and children, giving them a dignified and proper lifestyle.

Maria works raising and selling animals, a job that helps support her family.  She says that she has a lot of animals which she raises and then sells.  She says that she has good customers and that, thanks to this, she has good earnings.  That’s why she would like to be able to continue with this microenterprise.  

She views herself as a hardworking, fighting, and enterprising woman since there is nothing easy about her job.  She is applying for help from the foundation and Kiva in order to purchase animals to raise and later sell.  She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her since the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy small bigs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Nelson Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Nelson de 37 años de edad, está casado con la señora María de 38  años de edad, tienen 2 hijos, una niña de 10 años y un varón de 5 años.
Nelson es chapista de autos, tiene un taller propio donde realiza el servicio, se dedica a esto hace más de 10 años. Había empezado como ayudante trabajando con un señor que le había enseñado a realizar de forma profesional el trabajo. Con mucho esfuerzo monto para su taller donde tiene todo lo necesario para dar sus servicios. Su esposa se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos, y en horas libres realiza artesanía en ao po’i.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de un nuevo soldador, lo cual le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson is 37 years old and married to Sra. María, age 38. They have two children, a 10-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son.

Nelson performs auto body work. He has his own workshop where he provides his services and has been in business for more than 10 years. Nelson started out working as an assistant for another gentleman who taught him how to become a professional in this line of work. With great effort, he established his own shop and acquired everything he needed to provide this service. His wife takes care of their children. During his free time, Nelson makes crafts out of “ao po’i” (a fine cotton cloth that is unique to Paraguay).

He is requesting a loan to buy a new soldering iron, which will be a great help to his business. Nelson is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to buy a new soldering iron for his repair shop.

loans.name: Jorge Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una cantina en una pequeña escuelita de esa ciudad hace mas de 3 años. 
Jorge es muy responsable y profesional en su trabajo, busca siempre la excelencia en todo lo que hace, es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo por todo. El comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle lo mejor a su familia. 
En cuanto a su cantina nos dice que tiene muy buenas ventas ya que la escuela donde está ubicada tiene muchos alumnos, por ello solicita el crédito, ya que desea abastecer su negocio con galletitas, golosinas, gaseosas, y otro tipo de comestibles, los cuales tienen mucha salida. 
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is 26 years old and lives in the city of Itá. He has been operating a snack bar at a small school in the city for more than three years. Jorge is very responsible and professional in his work. He always seeks excellence in everything he does. This is why he strives to do his best at all times. He says that all of his efforts are focused on providing the best for his family.

Jorge says that his snack bar generates very good sales since the school where his business is located has many students. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can restock his business with cookies, candy, sodas, and other types of snacks in order to have good results. Jorge is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him. This loan will be of great help to this micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, sodas, and other types of snacks.

loans.name: Jacinto Aparicio

texts.es:
El Sr. Jacinto tiene 47 años de edad. El se dedica a la venta hamburguesas, panchos, y bebidas desde hace ya un tiempo. Nos cuenta que él trabajo desde muy joven en esto y que experiencia al respecto le sobra; con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro y montar su negocio y le gustaría poder seguir creciendo. 
Jacinto ya tiene una clientela bien formada en los alrededores del barrio; con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, ya que ellos son la razón de su vida y es por ellos que diariamente lucha, pues quiere darles lo mejor y que no pasen por privaciones. El necesita de este crédito para la compra de hamburguesas, panchos, y bebidas, los cuales son esenciales para su negocio. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y construir su propio local. 
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Jacinto is 47 years old. He has been selling hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages from some time. Jacinto says that he has worked from a very young age, so he has experience in this line of work. Through great effort and sacrifice, he was able to establish his business and would like to continue growing.

Jacinto already has a well-established customer base in the surrounding neighborhoods. Through his work, he has been able to make improvements to his home and provide the necessary education for his children. They are his reason for living, so he strives each day to give them the best so that they can avoid hardships.

He needs this loan to buy hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages since these are essential products for his business. Jacinto dreams of expanding his business and building his own shop. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been provided, since this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están en el ciclo numero uno y tiene 15 integrantes. Todas ellas desean salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto, ya que saben que la unión hace la fuerza. Tienen el deseo de darle a sus familias lo mejor para que no pasen privaciones. 
Una de ellas es la señora Juana, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo como ser: remeras, pantalones, blusas. Gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de todo tipo de prendas, como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras y demás. 
Ella al igual que sus amigas del comité está muy alegre dentro del programa de la fundación y desean llegar al máximo nivel.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé. The women are taking their first loan and they have 15 members. All of them wish to get ahead through their work in the group, because they know unity is strength. They want to provide more for their families so that they don't experience hardship.

One of them is Juana. She works selling clothes of all types such as: t-shirts, pants and blouses. Thanks to her work and her efforts she has been able to get ahead and help her family. She would like to continue with her business, and for this reason she is seeking the loan to buy all types of clothes like shirts, pants, t-shirts and more. 

She, like her friends in the communal bank, is very happy within the foundation's program and wishes to reach the highest level.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 62 años D. edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, está casada con Estalin, vive en compañía D. su esposo y su  hija D. 38 años D. edad, con los que comparte sus ideales, tiene una casa D. su propiedad la cual lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza María es la venta D. jugos D. frutas como manzana, papaya, especiales y sándwichs, para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño puesto D. ventas en el mercado informal D. su ciudad, en donD. atienD. a diario a sus clientes D. forma amable y alegre, actividad que lo ha realizado desD. hace 20 años, tiempo que supo ganarse a la clientela. Lo que le gusta D. su actividad es el poder sentirse productiva, la mantiene ocupada y la distrae, además que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda apoyar en los gastos D. la economía familiar, ahora cuenta con una regular clientela que le consumen todos sus jugos, teniendo bastante ganancias. Este será su crédito numero 6 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera D. su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por tanto se compromete una vez más en cumplir con los pagos D.  sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado D. 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en el mejoramiento D. la infraestructura D. su puesto, tanto paredes como piso, comprando  mesas y sillas. Además D. frutas para la preparación D. sus jugos.
texts.en:
María, 62, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She is married to Estalin, and lives with her husband and her 38-year-old daughter; with them she shares her ideals.  She has her own home, which they managed to buy with great effort.

María's job is selling fruit juices such as apple, papaya, and special juices, and sandwiches, for which she has a small stall in the informal market of her city, where she pleasantly and happily waits on her customers daily.  She has done this work for 20 years, during which time she learned how to earn customers.

What she likes about her job is being able to feel productive; it keeps her occupied and distracts her.  It also allows her to have an income with which she can help with the expenses of the family economy.  Now she has regular customers who consume all her juices, giving her plenty of profit.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes for your collaboration to continue with her goals.  For this reason she is committed once again to making the repayments.  She also likes being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the requested loan of 3000 PEN, she will improve the infrastructure of her stall, both the walls and the floor, buying tables and chairs.  She also will buy fruit for preparing her juices.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to improve the infrastructure of her stall.

loans.name: Orland

texts.en:
Orland is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Orland raises and sells pigs. 

Orland expresses his thanks to Kiva lenders with a loan he took out via Kiva and for the help he received from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. Orland was able to expand his business.  He purchased a piglet to raise and sell.  As a result of his efforts he had an excellent profit and is repaying his loan on time. 

Orland has been engaged in business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.  He has always invested his income back into his business, and he hopes to expand into a big piggery, with 10 piglets.

Additionally, Orland's success has enabled him to support his parents' daily basic needs. 

Orland expresses his utmost thanks to the people who supported his first cycle loan.

loans.use: to invest and expand his business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, deseosa de progresar, es conviviente con Dante, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Mónica es la venta de pollos, su actividad empieza levantándose de madrugada y se dirige a las granjas donde crían los pollos, en donde logra comprar a menores precios, para luego llevarlos a su casa y prepararlos para la venta. Para esto instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa, atendiendo a todos sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial, vendiendo unos pollos limpios bien preparados, siendo la mayoría de sus clientes sus propios vecinos, atendiendo desde hace 7 años , todo este tiempo contando con el apoyo de su pareja en sus ratos libres, pero generalmente lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual poder pagar los gastos propios del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, a los que quiere mucho y desea poder darles una mejor calidad de vida, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el atraso en el pago del crédito otorgado a algunos de sus clientes, pero no la desanima y sigue trabajando  buscando buenos clientes, ya que son el sostén de su negocio. Tiene planes de poder construir un galpón y allí criar pollos. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, agradece poder contar con un apoyo financiero con el cual poder avanzar en su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como lo hizo con los créditos anteriores. Además se siente contento con su grupo comunal, ya que considera  a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de pollos para ser vendidos en su negocio.
texts.en: Mónica is 42 years old and is a hard-working and happy woman with a strong desire to make progress. She is married to Dante, and they live with their two children, ages 12 and 7, in a home they own. Mónica makes a living selling chicken. She gets up at dawn and goes to the farms where they raise chickens and where she can buy them at the lowest prices. She then takes them to her home and prepares them for sale. She has a table set up in front of her home for this task, cordially and amicably tending to her customers and selling clean, well-prepared chicken. Most of her customers are her neighbors, and she has served them for the past seven years. During all this time she has counted on the support of her husband during his free time, but generally she does the work alone. What she likes most about her work is being able to count on income that she can use to cover household expenses and the education of her children, for whom she loves deeply and wants to provide a better quality of life. What she doesn't like about her job is late payments by her customers when she sells on credit, but it does not discourage her and she is always on the lookout for good customers since they are the sustenance of her business. She has plans to build a shed and raise chickens there. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful to be able to count on the financial support so she can advance her business. For this reason, she promises to make her payments on time, as she has done with previous loans. She enjoys being part of her community bank since she considers her fellow members to be responsible people with solidarity. She is requesting the loan so she can invest in the purchase of more chickens to then prepare and sell.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia.  His wife sells shoes.

Their elder daughter is a college student and a younger child is also a student. 

He started his taxi service business in 2002 by using his own car.  Taxi income is pretty much the same everyday, and it is not enough to pay the college fees.  Therefore, he and his wife decided to open a second hand clothes shop, based on his wife's experience.  They have already found the place to rent and bought a small amount of supplies. 

He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy used shoes for his wife's business.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for his wife's business.

loans.name: Yien

texts.en:
Yien, a 29-year-old married woman, sews clothes in a garment factory in the Ang Snoul district.  She is able to earn approximately $3.00 each day to support her family. 

Her husband is a construction worker. 

This couple is blessed with two children who attend a local public school. 

Yien has encountered a difficulty in traveling to work.  She doesn’t have her own motorcycle, so every day she has to spend money taking a motor taxi service. 

Now Yien would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a second-hand motorcycle. 

This loan will help her family reduce its transportation expenses.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre, le gustan el negocio y es  muy dedicada, está conviviendo con Richard, fruto de esta unión tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 14, 14  y 12 años; además de tener la compañía de su suegra quien los acompaña desde hace 6 meses atrás, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de ropa de primera calidad tanto para damas, caballero y niños, para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos a la ciudad de Lima, realizando sus compras en el emporio comercialde dicha ciudad, de donde trae lo último en moda. Sus ventas los realiza a crédito dejando 15 días  a amigos, familiares y recomendados. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, iniciándose con un capital que le brindó su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, comenta que ahorrando las ganancias de su actividad, logró realizar los acabados de su casa, y apoya con los gastos del hogar  a su pareja, sabiendo que apoyándose mutuamente lograrán progresar. Lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunos de sus clientes se atrasan con los pagos de sus créditos, pero ésto no la desanima y sigues buscando nuevos clientes, además de tener planes de abrir  un local propio en su casa, donde pueda exhibir y poner la venta de más ropa. Este será el préstamo numero 2 con a institución MFP, agradece la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más ropas de variados modelos en mayor cantidad  y a menor precio.
texts.en: Isabel is 35 years old and is a hard-working and happy woman who enjoys and is very dedicated to her job. She is married to Richard, with whom she has three children, ages 14, 14 and 12. Her mother-in-law has also lived with them for the past six month in a house they own. Isabel makes a living selling high-quality clothing for men, women and children, goods she acquires periodically on trips to the city of Lima, making her purchases at a commercial emporium in the city that features that latest fashions. She sells on bimonthly credit to friends, relatives and recommended customers. She has been dedicated to this activity for the past four years, starting out with funds her husband provided her. What she enjoys most about her work is the income she generates. She says that with money she saved from her job they were able to finish construction on their house and she has supported her husband with household expenses, knowing they will make progress together. What she doesn't like about her job is that some of her customers are late with their payments, but this does not discourage her and she is always on the lookout for new customers. Furthermore, she has plans to open up a store in her home where she can exhibit and put more clothing up for sale. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for the financial support so she can keep advancing with her business. She promises to make her payments on time. She is requesting the loan to purchase more clothing in various styles and in larger quantities at better prices.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Jaenly

texts.en:
Jaenly owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in her community.  She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Jaenly is 32 years old, married and has two grown-up children.  She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. 

Jaenly is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and to expand her store.

In 2011, Jaenly joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living conditions.  

She plans to reinvest her profits and doubled her income so she can improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and for the expansion of business venue.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, 54, is the leader of this group, which consists of three members. This group is from Kompong Chhnang province, Cambodia. All of them are taking this loan in order to raise some piglets individually. 

Mrs. Van is a local farmer, cultivating rice crops alongside her husband on her own farmland. Together, they can generate a profit of $4.00 per day from this land. The couple has four children, one of whom is already married and lives away from home. The other three children are now working as laborers in Thailand. 

This loan from Kiva will help Van's pig-raising business increase income for the family. In the future, she would like to greatly expand her piggery and buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: to buy some pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 61 años, está casada con Cayo, vive en compañía de su hijo mayor de 38 años, que aún es soltero, apoyándose en todo, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de comidas al paso como frituras, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y demás, para esto cuenta con una mesa que instala todos los días  en el frontis de su casa, en donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son los vecinas de la zona, y transeúntes en general. Lleva dedicándose a este oficio desde hace 5 años, contando con el apoyo de su esposo, quien siempre la acompaña y apoya en todo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse ocupada, estar en todo momento al lado de su esposo, además del ingreso económico que le genera, con el cual logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, y apoyar a sus familiares, contrario a esto, lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico que la ocasiona al termino de cada día de trabajo, refiere que se debe  a su edad  y estado de salud. Pero siendo una mujer muy tenaz, continua en actividad. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida de poder contar con un apoyo financiero con el cual podrá avanzar con su negocio. Para esto se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con los pagos de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que considera a todos sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, como aceites, arroz, harinas, papas y demás.
texts.en: Rosa is 61 years old and married to Cayo. They live with their eldest son, 38, who is still single and self-sufficient, in a home they own. Rosa makes a living selling fast food, such as french fries, fried chicken, fried rice and other items, every day on a table she has set up in front of her home. It is here where she very cordially tends to her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors or general passers-by. She has been doing this activity for five years and counts on the support of her husband, who is always by her side and supports her in everything. What she enjoys most about her work is that it keeps her busy, that she can share the task with her husband, and that with the income the business generates she can cover household expenses and support relatives. On the other hand, what she doesn't like about her work is the physical fatigue she feels at the end of each day due to her age and health, but being a very tenacious woman, she carries on. This will be her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels content and grateful to be able to count on the financial support so she can advance her business. She promises to make her payments on time. Furthermore, she is thankful to be part of her community bank, since she considers all the members to be responsible people with solidarity. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her meals, such as oils, rice, flour, potatoes and other items.

loans.use: to purchase oils, rice, flour, potatoes and other items.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa is 50 years old and lives with her son in ger (Mongolian tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  Her son runs a crafts shop. 

She started her salt commodity trading business in 2000 by renting a counter in a local market.  Usually she sells construction and grocery salt. 

Now that her business is going well, she wants to broaden the range of products that she sells.  She is a hardworking woman who says, "Now that my son is grown and independent, it is time to concentrate on my business."  

She is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy grocery salt and nuts.

loans.use: to buy grocery salt and nuts.

loans.name: Indolesa

texts.en:
Indolesa is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 56 years old, married and has three children. 

To make a living, Indolesa runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products such as soft drinks, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and more, in the local community. 

Indolesa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

Indolesa is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2011, Indolesa joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to create a reserve for future emergencies.				.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de ser muy alegre, es conviviente con José, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 38 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Elvira es la comercialización de abarrote, para esto abrió una pequeña bodega en su propia casa, desde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, a los que atiende muy amablemente, desde hace 6 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su bodega. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el atender al público, con los que socializa y se siente muy a gusto el poder pagarse sus amistades, así se distrae y se siente una mujer productiva, con lo que logra apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos de técnico electricista no les alcanzaba. Considera rentable su negocio gracias a que a ha sabido ganar una regular clientela, que le consumen sus productos, y le da una rotación constante, dejándole las ganancias correspondientes. En la actualidad, dado su edad, considera sola mantener su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar su apoyo con una capital de trabajo, desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por tanto se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad, con los cuales podrá surtir su bodega, así podrá seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Elvira, 59, is a hard-working, cheerful entrepreneur.  She lives with her common-law husband, José, and their two children, ages 22 and 38, whom they love very much.  They live in their own house.  Elvira sells groceries out of a small store she opened in her home where she receives her neighbors who are her main customers.  She has been in business for six years and is very kind to her customers, since what she enjoys most about her work is being able to socialize with her friends.  She keeps busy and feels she is being productive while helping to cover household expenses, since her husband's income as an electric technician does not always cover costs.  Her business is profitable since she has been able to establish a regular customer base who consume her products regularly meaning inventory turnover is constant and earnings are good.  Her goal now is to keep the business running.  This will be her 8th loan through the MFP institution.  She is grateful for the support and hopes to be able to continue counting on it, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The 2,000 PEN loan will be used to buy essential goods to add to the store's inventory to continue operating.

loans.use: To buy essential goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pots, plates, utensils and sodas.

loans.name: Amgalanbayar

texts.en:
Amgalanbayar is 20 years old and lives with his mother, wife and son in ger (Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. 

His mother is unemployed and his wife babysits their newborn child.  He is a certified welder who started welding in 2008 as employee of small company.  In September of 2011 he decided to open his own business.  He has already rented a place to run his business, however due to a shortage of equipment, he couldn't open for business. 

His rented workshop is right next to the main road and it is in an industrial district, therefore should be a profitable location. 

He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a welding machine to run his business.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine to run his business.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Jerome provides a motorcycle transport service and has been in business for five years.  He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and motorcycle maintenance.

Jerome has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jerome hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa is 26 years old and lives with his wife in ger (Mongolia tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. 

His wife is a kindergarten teacher. 

He started his plumbing business in 2010.  Since then, his business has been successful and he is well known for his low-cost and reliable service. 

His service is very convenient because he even takes on late night emergencies.  However, his tools are not sufficient to run a plumbing business. 

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I work with my full resources, however there are times when I can't fix things due to my tools." 

He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy tools.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre, deseosa de progresar. Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres, y su hermano menor de 18 años, que es estudiante, habitando en una casa de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Rosmery es la venta de ropa femeninas de todos los modelos, que  trae desde la ciudad de Lima, contando con una amiga en esa ciudad que le envía las ropa, así se ahorra en los gastos de viaje. Su mercadería lo vende entre amistades y familiares, quienes son sus principales clientes, e incluso trae a pedido, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 1 año. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico propia con el cual solventa sus gastos personales, también el tiempo libre que le sobra y los puede dedicar a otras actividades personales, por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es la impuntualidad en el pago de los créditos otorgados a algunos de sus clientes, pero esto no perjudica sus compromisos de pago, ya que es una persona responsable. Además considera su negocio rentable porque cuenta con una regular clientela, y desea  abrir una tienda de venta de ropas en una zona comercial y céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar en su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas para poder tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas femeninas en mayor cantidad y buscando menores precios,  para tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosmery, 23, is a hard-working, very cheerful woman who is anxious to get ahead.  She is single and lives with her parents and 18-year-old brother, who is in school.  The parents own the home.  Rosmery sells different styles of women's clothing which are sent to her from the city of Lima by a friend so she saves on travel expenses.  She sells the clothing to friends and relatives who are her main customers, sometimes on an order basis, and has been in business for a year.  What she likes most about her work is that she has her own income and can cover personal expenses, also the fact that she has free time to do other things.  What she likes least about her business is lack of puntuality among some of her credit customers, but this does not affect her payments because she is very responsible.  She feels her business is profitable because she has a regular customer base and hopes to open a clothing store in the commercial area in downtown Pucallpa.  This is her first loan through the MFP institution.  She is grateful for the financial support so she can grow her business and is committed to paying the loan back on time so she can request more loans.  The 1,000 PEN loan will be used to buy women's clothing in bulk at lower prices to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is aged 35 and married with three children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For over 4 years, Elvie has been engaged in the business of running a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and home-use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and other items. She earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month with her business.

Elvie joined GDMPC in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to use for purchasing additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chork, 49, a villager from Kompong Chhnang province, has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops for a living. She was chosen to be the leader of this group, which consists of three members. They have different purposes in using this fund: Chork and Som want to buy some piglets to raise; Ke wants to use it to buy more stocks of merchandise to sell. Chork has lived with her three children since her husband passed away. Chork will use her increase in income to support her last born child’s education. She wants to send him to  a university after he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Marilou has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts for copra (the dried meat of a coconut). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Sherlith

texts.es:
Sherlith, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre, dinámica. Es separada, vive en compañía de madre, padre y su hijo de 11 años de edad, habitando la casa de sus padres, desde que se separo de su pareja.
La actividad que realiza Serlith es la venta de jugos de papaya, manzanas, especiales y sándwich, contando para esto con un puesto ubicado en el mercedo informal de su ciudad, que logró ocupar hace 10 años, tiempo que lleva en este negocio. Paralelo a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de pollo broster,  para esto cuenta con una mesa que instala en el frontis de su casa por las noches, desde donde atiende a sus clientes que son sus vecinos, ambas actividades lo realiza sola. Lo que le gusta de su hogar es el poder contar con un ingreso económico, con el cual pueda pagar los estudios de sus hijos, y poder apoyar con los gastos de su hogar a sus padres, lo que no le gusta es el tener que levantarse de madrugada. Considera rentable por ver sus ganancia diaria, y por el momento comenta espera sol mantener sus negocios. Este será el préstamo numero 14 con la institución MFP, espera seguir contado con el apoyo financiero para  seguir avanzando con su negocio. Para esto se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con los pagos de sus cuotas. Se siente a gusto con su banco comunal  por que considera  todos lo miembros ser personas responsables y solidaria. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de una licuadora para su negocio de jugos, además de platos y utensilios.
texts.en:
Sherlith, 38, is a hard-working, cheerful, dynamic woman.  She is divorced and lives with her mother, father and 11-year-old son in her parents' home since the divorce.

Sherlith sells papaya, apple and other special juices and sandwiches.  She has a stall at the city market where she has been operating for ten years.  She also sells fried chicken at night in front of her house where she attends to her customers, most of whom are neighbors.  She runs both businesses on her own and enjoys being able to generate her own income to pay for her son's education and help cover her parents' household expenses.  This is her 14th loan through the MFP institution and she hopes to continue with the financial support in order to expand her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and is happy to be a part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy a blender for her juice business, as well as plates and utensils.

loans.use: To buy a blender, plates and utensils.

loans.name: Erdeneochir

texts.en: Erdeneochir is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his own house in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Two of his children study at school and the younger son is in kindergarten. After being unemployed for six years he started his business by building his own house and grocery shop in 2010. His wife works mainly in the grocery shop. He is a diligent and hardworking man. Now that his business is going well, he wants to make his grocery shop bigger and then broaden his business by selling electric goods. He needs 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy electric goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy electric goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Violeto

texts.en: Violeto is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Violeto has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Violeto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Violeto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en: Ilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Ilyn has a food shop that makes and sells snacks like rice and pan cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Ilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Ziorsi

texts.es: Ziorsi, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le gusta los negocios. Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres y sus dos hermanos menores de 13 y 6 años de edad, habitando una casa que es de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Ziorsi, es la venta de ropa de variados modelos y de buena calidad, vendiendo solo ropa para caballeros, que le envía una tía  desde la ciudad de Lima, cada 15 días, para venderlos entre sus amistades y conocidos al contado y en ocasiones al crédito a 10 días- También trae a pedido el modelo que le soliciten, dedicándose a esta actividad hace dos años, y realizándola sola en lo relacionado a la venta de los productos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico, con el cual pagará sus estudios, y apoya en ocasiones a sus padres en algunos gastos del hogar, así como el tiempo libre que le deja, con el cual ella lo dedica a sus estudios superiores, lo que no le gusta  es la impuntualidad en el pago de algunos créditos otorgados, pero no le ha traído problemas con sus compromiso de pagos. Además considera rentable su negocio porque tiene una regular clientela que en su mayoría son su compañeros de estudios, amigos y familiares. Desea en un futuro abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de  contar con un crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas, y tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1,300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa en mayores cantidades a menos precios, y así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Ziorsi, 22, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who enjoys business transactions.  She is single and lives with her parents and two younger bothers, ages 13 and 6.  They live in their own home.  Ziosi sells different styles of top quality men's clothing, which an aunt of hers in Lima sends every two weeks.  Most of her customers are friends and acquaintances and she sells on a cash or 10-day credit basis.  She also brings in clothing on an order basis and has been in business for two years.  She handles the selling aspect of business on her own.  What she likes best is having her own income to pay for her education and sometimes help her parents wtih household expenses, as well has having free time to study.  What she likes least is the lack of payment punctuality on the credit she gives some customers, but this has not interfered with her loan payment commitment.  She feels her business is profitable because she has a regular customer base comprised of colleagues, friends and relatives.  In the future she wants to open a clothing store in downtown Pucallpa.  This is her first loan through the MFP institution and she is grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time so she can have access to more loans.  The 1,300 PEN loan will be used to buy bulk clothing at lower prices so she can increase earnings.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Ayurzana

texts.en: Ayurzana is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolia yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. His wife is a nurse, his older son is a carpenter, and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He started his taxi service business in 2002 when he moved to the center of the province from a rural area. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "My income has been increased since I moved here, however, my car is getting old therefore, nobody wants to sit in my car." He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy four tires and four antirattlers for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy four tires and four anti-rattlers

loans.name: Berly

texts.en:
Berly is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Berly has a shop that sells canned goods, detergent & shampoo. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, detergent and shampoo.
Berly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Berly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent and shampoo.

loans.name: Bolorerdene

texts.en: Bolorerdene is 30 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in ger (Mongoian yurt) in Govi-sumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is a fireman and her daughter goes to kindergarten. She started her sewing business in 2010 when she finished her sewing training. She is an incredibly talented seamstress; however, her sewing machine is not a professional one so she needs to purchase one. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I need to change my sewing machine in order to be more efficient and fast; if I had a better machine, I would have a lot more customers". She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Reynaldo has a shop that sells different sizes of lumber & bamboo for fencing.  He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy lumber & timber to sell.
Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy lumber & timber to sell.

loans.name: 06.02.05-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan has an iron furniture manufacturing business. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

Loan is 30 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Loan is the group leader of the 06.02.05-Đông Vệ solidarity group which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
She has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

loans.name: Maileen

texts.en:
Maileen is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Maileen has a shop that makes & sells snacks like pancakes & banana cues. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Maileen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maileen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maricel has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Rinelda

texts.en:
Rinelda is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rinelda is 39 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Rinelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Rinelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rinelda would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old and married with a child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elma has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Elma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with nine children. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Marites has a shop that sells dressed chickens, a variety of dried fish & green bananas. She has had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of dressed chickens, dried fish & bananas for resale. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dressed chickens, dried fish & bananas for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old. She is married and has eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other tools for farming.

Myrna has been farming sugar cane for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other tools for farming.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora is 48 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school. Diodora works very hard to provide for her family.

Diodora runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Diodora has been in this business for four years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Diodora would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 24 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenalyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for eight years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Lydia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 49 years old. Elisa is married and has two adult-aged children.

To make a living, Elisa owns and operates a business selling "suman" in the local community. Suman is a Filipino rice cake steamed in banana leaves.

Elisa has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elisa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make suman.

In 2011, Elisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business as well as to improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make "suman" (rice cakes).

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 10 children. 

Franklin provides motorcycle-taxi or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle-taxi services.

Franklin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Franklin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcyle-taxi services.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a business buying and selling DVDs in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell to customers.

Maribel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 40 years old.

Maribel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pumping machine and to pay for the electrical connection fees.

loans.name: Sermon

texts.en:
Sermon is 44 years old. She is married and has nine children.

Sermon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, detergents and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Sermon has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Sermon aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, detergents and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, a 53-year-old married mother of 10, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years now. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Edna is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages, and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Baatarzana

texts.en:
Baatarzana is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits their newborn child. Baatarzana started his transportation business in 2006 with his own car, transporting people to the rural areas and buying raw wool and cashmere to resell.

Unfortunately, a few months ago his van's engine developed a problem, forcing a halt to his business. A sharp and hardworking man who says, "It has been terrible since my van broke up. My child has been born and he needs me," Baatarzana is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 to purchase spare parts to repair his van.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his van.

loans.name: Charmen

texts.en:
For over two years in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Charmen, a 28-year-old married mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Charmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. 

Francisco has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Francisco has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francisco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie, 49, is a married man with two grown children. Charlie is a very responsible father and husband. He does everything he needs to do just to meet the needs of his family.

Charlie is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He dreams that someday his farm business will expand, so he will be able to improve the quality of life in his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 36 years old, married, and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lucresia has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from videoke (karaoke) rentals.

Lucresia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Myrna has a shop that sells snacks such as pancakes, rice cakes, and banana cues  (This is is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for 10 years. 

Myrna is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Yoland runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She also earns additional income from selling buko (coconut water) juice.

Yolanda is requesting a loan for  50,000 PHP loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  This is Yolanda's tenth loan from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chultem

texts.en:
Chultem is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, his elder child graduated from college and is employed, and his middle daughter university student and the youngest attends a secondary school. 

He started his taxi service business in 1999 using his own car. Also, he is a part time security guard in a mining company. Now that his car is old, he is losing a lot of customers to the newer cars. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "I don't like to waste time and opportunity. I have one child who is in college and she needs my support now." 

He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy new fence for his family.

loans.use: To buy new fence for his family

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene, 32, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Charlene has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Charlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin is a 42-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Minallo in the province of Isabela. He has been growing and selling rice since 1991. When he started, he was producing 50 sacks of rice, but now he produces 150 sacks. He faces the challenge of high labor costs. His dream is to diversify his business by growing more crops, and to educate his children. Delfin is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seed for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is from Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Antonina is married and has four children.

To make a living, Antonina runs a general store selling a variety of foods and household products such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and much more. Antonina has been in this business for over four years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Antonina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her store. In 2011, Antonina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leofredo

texts.en:
Leofredo is always aiming for better yields and a larger profit with every crop. He strives to attain his aims. He doesn’t want his children to experience what he has had to experience. Leofredo did not finish his elementary education because his parents were not able to send him to school, even though he wanted to attain a higher level of education.

Leofredo is 43 years old, married, and has four children. The three of his children who are currently in school are in high school and college. One of his children is already finished and pursued a degree with his profits from farming. Through farming and planting rice in his field, Leofredo is able to send his children to school.
 
Leofredo’s goals push him to continue improving his farming techniques. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy hybrid rice seed, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide that he will use in rice farming. He hopes that the loan will help him to improve his farming techniques.

loans.use: to buy hybrid rice seed, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide that will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Joan has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Joan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marlina is 52 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marlina has a natural medicine business in the Philippines. Marlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Marlina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.name: Erenita

texts.en:
Erenita is 60 years old and a widow with three children. Erenita works very hard to provide for them.

Erenita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erenita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned good and other groceries. 

Erenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imee is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imee has a hat-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her hat making business.

Imee has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hat-making business.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.en:
Wilbert is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Wilbert provides "tricycle"  (pedicab) services. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools for the tricycle or pedicab.

Wilbert has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wilbert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the tricycle (pedicab).

loans.name: Montessa

texts.en:
Montessa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a meat-vending business in the Philippines.

Montessa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meats to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for two years.
