In the future, Montessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 49,000 through NWTF to buy items like pants, T-shirts, slippers and other items to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for eight years. Mary Grace  earns more income from manicure/pedicure and food vending. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, T-shirts, slippers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a married man. He lives in the community of Minallo of the province of Ilagan.

Last season, due to the natural disaster of a drought, his small plot of rice did not grow properly. This disaster made him fail to get the income he used to get and needs to get by in life. 

Pedro is a  man who is loved and respected in the place where he lives. He is dedicated to his work, agriculture in season, and in his free time, he works in tire repair. Pedro is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to improve his crops and increase his production in order to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life. The loan will really help Pedro in the hard work that he does.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow crops.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Annaliza has a shop that sells dried fish and homemade sausages or longganisa, which she has been doing for three years. 

Annaliza is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of dried fish and raw ingredients for longganisa.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and raw ingredients for longganisa (homemade sausages).

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 52 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in the Philippines. Genoveva has a food shop or canteen that sells snacks such as pancakes, rice cakes, and chocolate cakes, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Genoveva is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genoveva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Gunsmaa

texts.en:
Gunsmaa is 56 years old and has two children who live with her in her house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. The older child works, while the younger one studies in college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital Mongolia. 

Gunsmaa had been working as a snipper in a sewing section until it was abolished in 1984. Now, in the market economy, she started her own sewing business, which she has been doing for 18 years. She makes costumes and gowns by order and has one employee. 

Gunsmaa is requesting a loan for 2,800,000 MNT, which she will use to buy fabric.	She is hardworking, helpful, and healthy who states, "It is possible to run my business successfully and constantly in the future."

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Merlyn has a corn field where she grows corn grains to sell during harvest time. She also makes charcoal & sells copra. She has had these businesses for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar owns and manages his corn farming business. He is proud that he is a farmer. Edgar has managed his corn fields for almost 20 years and he is able to earn an income of P45,000 per crop season but he uses this amount for school fees, household expenses and allowances for his children. He devotes full-time in improving his corn fields because he would like to earn a greater amount to provide for his family's needs. He is 40 years of age and married with two children. He is glad because he has a supportive wife.

Edgar aims to increase his yields this coming crop season because his crops were destroyed by the typhoons "Pedring and Quiel". With this circumstance, his profit is no longer sufficient and that's the reason why he is asking for additional capital amounting to P50,000 which will be used in buying fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to improve the growth of his crops. He is hoping that he can obtain his goal in life and most of all he will be able to send his children into higher education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for agricultural business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Nestor has a shop where he sells fish like sardines, milk fish & trout. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Nestor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nestor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jamiyansuren

texts.en:
Jamiyansuren is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is an economist and right now she cares for her children at home. He worked in a television studio before. His major is in engineering, therefore, he started his cell phone selling and repair business in 2010. 

Jamiyansuren is a strong and hard-working man who wants to expand his business by buying new equipment in order to fix more complicated cell phones. He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase cellphone parts and cellphones.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone parts and cellphones.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Nenita has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Antonieta has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings & vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables.

Antonieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Antonieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoun is 56 years old. She has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops, together with her husband, in Prey Chor district. This couple grows rice crops in both rainy season and dry season. Agriculture is the sole of their income. Together, they are able to make a profit of $4.00 per day and work hard to support the family. 

Chhoun has four single children who are living under her care, while their other two children are married and live independently. With the sum of KHR 600,000 from Kiva, she will buy rice seeds and mineral fertilizers. This loan will help increase their income that is used to solve the financial needs in the family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Lourdesina

texts.en:
Lourdesina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Lourdesina has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lourdesina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lourdesina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha wants to prove that even a woman can do farming activities. Alpha is 39 years old, married with four children who are in college and high school levels of education. 

Alpha’s husband is a farmer, her partner in managing their farm. Alpha and her husband plant rice in their village. Most of her earnings in farming have gone for the education of her children. 

Alpha wants to gain higher income from her farm to further support her children's education and uplift their living standard. Alpha is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor in farming activities. She hopes to maintain her business in farming and able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her son in a ger (or traditional Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province. His mother is retired and her son is a college student. She started her business in 2004 by renting a small space in a hair salon. She has done well, and has used her earnings to buy a house and pay her son's college tuition. Competition is increasing, and she needs to upgrade her equipment and do some repairs to her shop. She is committed to work hard, and describes her goals for her business this way: "There are a lot of nice shops now. I need to fix my place and renew my equipment or else I am going to lose my customers." She is applying for a loan for 2,500,000 MNT to buy new chairs and equipment.

loans.use: to upgrade her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Emerlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emerlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Emerlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
At her age of 61, Dominga is still strong and determined to acquire income and provide sustenance for her family. She is a widow and has four children. To make a living, Dominga raises hogs to fatten and breed and in future sell to butchers. At present, she had three pigs to sustain. Dominga has been in this business for five years and earns approximately P7,000 whenever she can dispose of a pig. 

Dominga is now asking for a loan of P17,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for her hogs sustainability. She had insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan and she wants to provide good nutrition for her hogs to offer them at a higher cost upon sale. 

Despite her status in life, Dominga still aims to keep growing as an entrepreneur and in future achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines.

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his own house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed; his elder son is 8 years old and goes in local primary school, his two younger daughters, 5 and 3 years old, go to kindergarten. 

Janarbek has been doing a car repair on call service since 2000. Now he has managed to establish his own auto repair center, and he buys old cars to repair and sell. He is a courteous and decent man who says, "Enlarging my auto repair center will benefit my business." He needs a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy old cars.

loans.use: To buy old cars.

loans.name: El's Group

texts.en:
These are two members who joined together as a group to ask for a loan from Kiva’s funders. Mrs. El, 43, is the leader of this group and is in the business of cultivating rice crops. She is living with eight single children in Kompong Chhnang province. Some of her children are now working in different careers. 

During this month of November, Mrs. El, like most Cambodian farmers, is ready to harvest her rice crop from the fields. Mrs. El is taking out this loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy more glutinous rice to make "Ambuk" (pounded glutinous rice that can be eaten directly with ripe bananas or coconut milk) for sale. With the increase in income she’ll earn, she wants to save to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more glutinous rice to make "Ambuk" for sale.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим женат и любящий отец пятерых детей. Вот уже 9 лет Рахим работает в сфере агробизнеса. Он занимается выращиванием картофеля и зерноводством, а также откормом скота. Он держит скот за счет кормов выращенных на земельном участке. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью Рахим планирует, построить еще один коровник. Рахим запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена пшеницы.
texts.en: Rahim is married and is a loving father of five children.  He has been working in the agricultural business for nine years.  Rahim grows potatoes and cereal crops and is also involved in fattening up livestock.  He sustains livestock with the fodder grown on his land plot.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Rahim plans to use the profit to build another cowshed.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu lives with her husband and two daughters in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber province in Mongolia. She is a strong and hardworking woman who works as an inspector of an accommodation owner's union besides her raw materials selling business. She sells plastic bottles, glasses, etc. She runs her business by herself and her husband looks after their younger daughter. 

Sometimes her elder daughter helps her in her business which she began in 2008. She is the one who finds her business beneficial and wants to broaden it by possessing two or three raw material receiving points. She says, "I'm recognising that my business will be successfully developed."  She needs a 200,000 MNT loan to purchase more pots and plastic bowls.

loans.use: To purchase more pots and plastic bowls.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a jolly 38-year-old married mother of two school-age children, has been patiently selling fruits and vegetables in her neighborhood, offering squash, eggplant and tomatoes on a house-to-house basis for a year now. Though the work is tiresome, she is very determined to acquire profits.

Now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy more eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell, Vilma wants to improve her sales and earn more profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: Purevjav is 45 years old and lives with her two daughters and one granddaughter in a ger (or traditional Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province. Her older daughter is a teacher and her granddaughter is in kindergarten. She worked in the province's gasoline station for 11 years. In 2000, she started her own business selling food items in the school cafeteria. She has done well and would like to expand her business so that she sells stationery as well as food. She is a very hardworking and precise person who is committed to give her granddaughter a good education so that she can have a rewarding career. Purevjav is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin has operated his agricultural business for almost 20 years. He is grateful because he is able to provide his family's needs. Franklin is 43 years old and married, having four children. He lives simply with his wife and children. He patiently manages his farming business to earn a living. Franklin finds difficulties in managing his cornfield, but he always thinks positively and finds ways to maintain and improve his farming business.

Franklin is in need of additional working capital because his crops were destroyed by disastrous typhoons "Pedring" and "Quiel."  He had been expecting a higher income this crop season but due to the said circumstance, he was not able to obtain the income he was expecting. For this reason, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of his corn crops and maintain his farming business.

According to him, these farm inputs would really have a great impact on the development of his farming. He is hoping that he can increase his yields, allowing him to improve his living situation and give his children a better future and a quality education

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of his corn crops and maintain his farming business.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 37 years old. She is married and she has two children who are going to school. She wants them to have a better education and standard of living, so she has to work hard. 

Her main job is farming. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

In 2009 she participated in SEDA to borrow money. This is her third loan. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 56 years of age, married and blessed with four children. His three children already finished their college while the youngest is still in college. 

Antonio is engaged in the farming business. He plants rice in their village. He has been in this business for almost 29 years. Antonio usually earns a net income of  PHP 10,000 per crop in his farm.
 
Sometimes, his earning depends on climate, variety of seeds and amount of fertilizers applied in his crops. Antonio wishes to buy hybrid seeds of rice to increase his earnings. It was a big help for him to get a better yield if he applied an exact amount of fertilizers in his farm. Hence, Antonio is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers to be applied to crops to get a better yield.

Antonio looks toward the success of his farming business. He hopes to gain a higher income and be able to continue sending his child to school to pursue his degree.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers to be applied to crops to get a better yield.

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en:
Lhagvadulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. 

Her husband is a healthy strong man who works as a builder. Their two eldest children are school students. 

She operates a clothes trading business. She has been working as a seller in the "Mon mandal" market since 2005. Now that she has 900,000 MNT in current assets,  she is earning a salary. 

She is an unpliant and gentle woman who says, "Even [though] I am satisfied with my work and salary, I need more income, because our family's usage is rising too, as my children grow." 

She needs 1,300,000 MNT loan for buying winter clothes such as boots, coats and scarves, etc.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes such as boots, coats and scarves, etc.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 31 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong Bac Ninh. She is married and she has one child who is going to school. 

She not only grows rice, but also she sells fast food. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She sometimes needs a loan to expand her business, so she has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she borrows from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Nyamaa, 48, lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His eldest child is a college student, while the other two attend high school. With assistance from his wife, Nyamaa operates a meat-sales business which he started in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. He now owns three counters and has one employee.

Meat prices will rise with the approach of winter, so Nyamaa needs to save some supplies in order to run his business successfully. He is requesting a loan of 2,650,000 MNT to buy livestock. A sharp and diligent man, Nyamaa says, "It is hard to pay the kids' tuition; however I will do whatever I can to support my children."

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед женат, имеет 4 детей. Он трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 7 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Он продает масло, сахар, конфеты, макароны, соки и т.д. А также он продает хозяйственные товары. Хуршед начал свой бизнес с малого оборота, а постепенно расширяя бизнес открыл еще один магазин. Теперь он хочет открыть другой магазин для продажи одежд с целью расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он запрашивает займ.
texts.en: Khurshed is married and has four children.  He is a hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products for over seven years.  Khurshed sells oil, sugar, candy, pasta, juice, etc., and also household goods.  He started his business with a small turnover and opened another store, while gradually growing his business.  And now he wants to open yet another store to sell clothing in order to expand his business.  This is why he is requesting the loan.

loans.use: to open another store and expand his business

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en: Bilqees earns a living by selling blankets and is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to buy more of them to sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her income and her profits. Her husband works for the government and her two sons are also employed. Bilqees is 59 years old but is still very active and performs her household duties very efficiently. She has been in her line of work for many years and is confident that this loan will help her improve her business and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en: Munawar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a scrap dealer. He will use the loan to buy more scrap items to sell, including used papers and plastic bottles. He works 8-10 hours a day, reselling these items to his customers. Munawar is a housewife who spends her days at home caring for her seven children and performing her household duties. Her family was too poor to provide her with an education. Her oldest son is 20 years old and helps his father in his business. Munawar is very hopeful that securing this loan will allow her to husband to improve his business and provide his family with a better life. In the photo, she is the person holding the book.

loans.use: to improve her husband's business.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Последние 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей продовольственных товаров. Она продает широкий ассортимент сладостей, также хозяйственных товаров. В бизнесе помогает ей муж, и они вместе дружно работают для обеспечения будущего своих детей. Адиба хочет расширить свой бизнес с целью получения большей  прибыли. С этой целью она запрашивает займ, и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Adiba is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling grocery products for the last ten years.  Adiba sells a wide variety of sweets and also household goods.  Her husband helps her in this business, and they work well together in order to provide for their children's future.  Adiba wants to expand her business with the goal of making a large profit.  This is why she is requesting this loan and thanks you in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Sobirzhon

texts.ru: Собиржон занимается продажей масел. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка и присматривает за ребенком, а он обеспечивает семью. Он работает усердно для того чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях,  с этой целью он открыл свой бизнес. Сперва он продавал рыбу, а потом открыл еще точку для продажи масла. Он продает рыбу сезонно. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки разных сортов масла и расширения бизнеса. Заранее  благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Sobirzhon sells cooking oil. He is married and a loving father of a child. His wife stays at home and takes care of their child, while Sobirzhon provides for the family. He is working hard to make sure his family has a good life and for this purpose he has started a business. Originally he was selling fish and now he also opened a market stall which sells cooking oil, as he only sells fish when it's in season. Sobirzhon would like to take out a loan to purchase many different types of cooking oils and so to expand his inventory. He would like to thank all of his lenders in advance for their support and charity.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married with four children. He is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Manuel operates a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 16 years, and every month he earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Manuel has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Manuel hopes to finish the education of his children and to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita Salvador is from the village of Alibagu in the province of Isabela. She is 56 years old, married, and has children.

Teresita owns and operates a business buying and selling used bottles and steel in her junk shop. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month for these activities.

Teresita is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She hope that someday her business will improve so that she can provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bottle, paper, and steel for her junk shop business

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her decorative embroidery business. She adopted this profession of decorative embroidery to financially support her husband. He is involved in a fruit-selling business. He sells fresh seasonal fruits to his customers at reasonable rates. 

She is the mother of six children: four of them also operate embroidery businesses, while the youngest two are students in 9th and 3rd grade respectively. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, and sketches in bulk quantity that will allow her to fulfill the client requirements and increase her income.
 
She has been operating her business for past 10 years and is very confident about her business growth. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Mairamkhan

texts.ru: Майрамхан целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 17 лет она занимается продажей продуктов питания. У неё широкий ассортимент товаров, разные виды сладостей, консервные продукты, сахар, мука, макароны и т.д. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, и хочет открыт еще одну торговую точку в центре рынка, который позволит ей получать хорошую прибыль. С этой целью она запрашивает займ, и заранее благодарит вас всех за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Mairamkhan is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman. For more then 17 years she has been managing a grocery stall. She has a wide range of goods for sale: sweets, canned food, sugar, flour, pasta and the like. She wants to expand her business and open a second stall at the center of the towns' market, which is sure to yield good profits. For this purpose Mairamkhan is requesting a loan and would like to thank in advance fo your support and help.

loans.use: to expand her business and open a new store in the center of the market

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 23 years old and single. For the past four years, he has run a business raising hogs. His dream is to expand his piggery to provide a stable source of income until he has his own family. He will strive to maintain his business. At present, Jonas is helping his parents with their family's expenses because his parents are experiencing a financial shortage in a time of crisis.

Jonas is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buys piglets and feed. He hopes to make his dream a reality and be able to extend help to his parents.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en: Engaging into a direct selling business is the main source of income for Eveline. She sells cosmetics, clothes and other personal products to her customers. She really wants to sustain her business and provide her customers demands but she has insufficient capital so she decided to ask for a financial assistance to ASKI through KIVA. She is requesting to avail a loan amounting to P10,000 to purchase dress, lotion and umbrella to sell to her customers. She hopes that lenders will approve her request to be able to achieve her goals in life. The income that she will generate will be used to sustain her business and to save some funds for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy dress, lotion and umbrella to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has for the last seven years earned a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pervelita

texts.en:
Pervelita is a married woman with two children. Pervelita is 31 years old and resides in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Pervelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Pervelita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Pervelita wants to make improvements to her house and to have her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Tserenbaatar

texts.en: Tserenbaatar is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and looks after their young daughter. His eldest son is a student and the other one is in kindergarten. Tserenbaatar transports sacked coal and meat by his Frontier car and had been selling them since 2005. Now he owns an automobile. In winter, he buys cattle and then sell them, and he is thinking of continuing this business. He is a laconic and shy man who says, "Now it is time to work and earn money as I am young and healthy." He is requesting a loan of  3,000,000 MNT to buy more meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Zandra

texts.en: Zandra is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Zandra has a shop that sells soaps, detergents, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy soaps, detergents, and beverages. Zandra has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Zandra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents, and beverages

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Andresa has a shop that sells homemade ice candies and fruit salad candy bars. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy.
Andresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Andresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives with her spouse and children in the Alibagu Province of Isabela. Her spouse helps with her business, and her daughter is a student. She runs a grocery shop business. 

Now that winter is approaching, she saw a business opportunity to sell firewood in her shop. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "I am the only one in my family with the income, so I have to work [as] hard as possible in order to support them."

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy different products such as snack foods, spices, sugar, and firewood for her shop.

She hopes that someday she can improve her store to make more income, so her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different products such as snack foods, spices, sugar, and firewood for her shop.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very helpful and has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a hairdresser and operates his barber shop in the market.

With the loan he will buy scissors, shaving creams, and hair products such as shampoos to improve the quality of his services and increase his income. He has a vast experience in his field of work, and Kalsoom is very confident that an investment will help him make more profits from his business.

Kalsoom is the mother of five children: one of them works while the others are getting their education by attending the local school.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: to buy scissors, shaving creams, and hair products such as shampoos for her husband's barber shop business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Flordeliza has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & candies. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & candies.

Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Constancia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Constancia has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Constancia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 48 years old, married, and has children. She is from the village of Alibagu, province Isabela.  Estrella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She earns 4,000 PHP a month.

Estrella is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, Estrella hopes to expand her store to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices, drinks, canned goods, and snack foods.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Jocelyn has a shop that sells corn during harvest time & green bananas. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for bananas & corn fields.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for bananas & corn fields

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 38 years old. She lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh.  She is married and has two children who are going to school. She always wants to have a better standard of living and  to have her children have a better education. So she tries to work hard. She has a store where she sells cobbler. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and always repaid punctually.  In this loan cycL. she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things to invest in her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things for her store.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер активный и трудолюбивый парень. Более двух лет он работает таксистом и любит свою деятельность. Чтобы начать данный бизнес  ему помогли его родители, они купили ему автомобиль, чтобы он мог обеспечить себя. Теперь Алишер не хочет просить  родителей о предоставлении средств. Ему нужны средства для ремонта своего автомобиля, чтобы продолжить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ. Заранее он благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Alisher is an energetic and hardworking fellow. For more then two years he has been working as a taxi driver and likes this business. He started his taxi service with the help of his parents who purchased the car so that he could provide for himself. Now Alisher doesn't want to rely on his parents for additional support. He needs money to repair his vehicle so that he can continue his taxi business. With this goal in mind he is requesting a loan. He would like to thank you in advance for your kindess and charity.

loans.use: to repair the car

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with one child. Teresita is 63 years old and resides at Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Philippines. 

Teresita owns and operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables, such as mangoes, to earn a living.  She's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000PHP. 

She requested a loan of 12,000PHP to purchase additional seeds & seedlings to raise. Teresita is been a member of GDMPC for almost two years.  In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to complete her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds & seedlings to raise

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha has been running a curio shop to earn a living.  Previously, she requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy necklaces and African design fabric.  With the additional stock she made good sales.  Her desire is to grow her business and get enough capital to build rental houses.  She has requested 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy necklaces and soapstone carvings.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and soapstone carvings.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. Gemma has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She had this business for 10 years.

Aside from the retail shop, she also operates a motorcycle transport business for extra income. Her husband helps her in managing her businesses.

Gemma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy spare parts such as tires and oil for her motorcycle in order to maintain a good service for the community. Each month, she earns about 5,000 PHP from both of her businesses. She will use the income that she will generate to pay for the school fees of her children.

In the future, Gemma hopes that her businesses will improve so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as tires and oil for her motorcycle

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Wilfreda has a shop, from which she sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Wilfreda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Wilfreda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Virginia sells canned goods, noodles & coffee powder in her shop. She has had this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, noodles & coffee powder.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & coffee powder.

loans.name: Criselia

texts.en:
Criselia is a married young woman with one child. She is 23 years old and lives in Isabela. 

Criselia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to gain more profit and to finish paying for her child's studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 31-year-old married lady who has three children.  She has been selling clothes for two years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in financial management and this has helped her to save her money and to invest in her business.  She has managed to grow her business because of her hard work, and hopes to expand into wholesale in five years.  With her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she will buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она работает преподавателям и одновременно занимается скотоводством. Она очень старательная и усердно работает. За последние 10 лет она окармливает скот и расширяет бизнес. В бизнесе ей помогает муж. От ранее полученных доходов она отремонтировала дом и улучшила условия дома. Теперь она хочет расширить бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы купить детям кровати. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки 8 голов крупного рогатого скота. Она надеется на вашу поддержку, и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Zarrina is married and a loving mother of two children. She works as a teacher and supplements her income by raising livestock. She is very diligent and works very hard. For the last 10 years she has been raising cattle and expanding her herd. Her husband helps her with this business. Using profits from her business she was able to repair their home and improve their living conditions. Now Zarrina would like to expand her herd so that she can use additional profits to buy her children new beds. She would like to take out a loan to purchase 8 heads of cattle and she is hoping for your support and would like to thank you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Prodencio

texts.en:
Prodencio is married and blessed with one child. He is lucky to be married to a housekeeper, his partner in managing their rice farming business. Aside from farming, Prodencio is also engaged in hog raising. He has now been managing his hog raising business for 10 years and wishes to maintain it. 

Prodencio is now 36 years of age and he desires to make his business site larger. Prodencio works hard and patiently to attain his goals. With the high cost of feed in the market, together with the expenses of tricycle tranportation of the goods, Prodencio is asking for financial support amounting to PHP 25,000. He will use the funds to buy pig feed in the market. This loan will be a big help for him to minimize his tricycle fare expenses because he will be able to buy sacks of feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs in the market.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Enrique provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for gasoline.

Enrique has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Enrique hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for gasoline for the transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the sugarcane farm

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 54 years old and has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who sells shopping bags. With the loan, he will buy shopping bags in larger quantities that will allow him to sell more to his clients and earn better profits. 

Safia is a housewife who spends her time on her household responsibilities. Her husband is a goldsmith and sells gold, silver and also artificial jewelry. He is known for his good customer dealings and beautiful jewelry collection. 

Safia is the mother of 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her other children are getting their educations. 

She is very confident that an investment will help her son’s business to grow further and help him establish his business which he started a year ago.

loans.use: to buy shopping bags to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 27 year old single man.  For five years, he has been selling second-hand clothes.  He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  He has also managed to improve the business with financial support from Faulu Kenya.  Now, he hopes to expand his business and open another business outlet in the near future.  He needs 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy trousers to sell.

loans.use: To buy trousers to sell

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is a 50-year-old woman, and she is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer and also drives the jeep. 

Eda wants to help her husband repair and paint the van, but she doesn't have enough money. So she needs to take out a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). When Eda gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband repair and paint the taxi. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase the family's income which in turn will improve the family's living conditions. 

Eda is a very loving mother and wife; she does everything for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, tires, and pay for the maintenance of her van

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Нурулло предоставляет услугу. Он арендует помещение, где открыл парикмахерскую. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов и ремонта помещения.
texts.en:
Nurullo lives in the city of Kulob. He is 57 years old, married and has four children. Nurullo has been working in the service industry for six years. He rents a space were he has opened a barber shop. Nurullo needs to take out this loan to purchase tools and repair the facilities.

Нурулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Нурулло предоставляет услугу. Он арендует помещение, где открыл парикмахерскую. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов и ремонта помещения.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools and repair the facilities

loans.name: Dezy's Group

texts.en:
Dezy is 46 years old, she is very active and performs her duties very efficiently. Her husband operates a painting business. He paints buildings and houses on order. He is very good at his work and receives regular orders every month. 

Dezy is a housewife, she spends her time staying at home and taking care of her household responsibilities. 

She has three sons, none of whom could get education due to financial constraints. Her second son is a hairdresser by profession and contributes to the family financially from his earnings while others stay at home and don't do anything. 

Dezy has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son's hairdressing business. With the loan investment he will buy scissors, shaving creams and other barber shop business products to improve his business. 

He has operated his business for many years and Dezy is very confident about his success. 

Note: in the picture the lady holding a passbook in her hand is Dezy.

loans.use: to buy scissors, shaving cream and other products for his barber shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, age 49, is a determined person. She aims to continuously generate good income from her business. She is proud that through her daily income generated from her business, she was able to send her children to school. She has four children and all of them now hold a degree. She had been managing her small store for almost five years. She usually sells milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to the people in her place of residence. 

Gloria needs to access a loan in the amount of P20,000 to buy school supplies such as pads of paper, crayons, folders, pencils and pens. She wants to purchase these items to diversify her business. She wants to sell more products in her store to generate a higher income. 

In the future, Gloria hopes to see her small store grow into a grocery store and make her financially stable.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as pads of paper, crayons, folders, pencils and pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a calf to raise and to pay for a rented lot.

loans.name: 03.4 .63-Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lý has a business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

 Lý is 32 years old and she is married with two children. Lý is the group leader of the 03.4.63-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010,  Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lý has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lý has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lý hopes for her business to do well. With her business profit,  she hopes to make her family healthy and happy and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailoring of clothes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 31-year-old Lebanese man, engaged to be married and  living on his own. He has been working as a fisherman for over 10 years and bought his individual fishing boat in 2006. He buys frequently needed tools from a local fishing center to proceed with his business operation. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy required fishing equipment and supplies. He feels positive about his business prospects for the coming year and looks forward to purchasing another fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy required fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and is a married woman with seven children. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. Editha sells items like vinegar, sugar and detergent to the people in her community. Each month, Editha earns 10,000 PHP with her business.

Editha has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, soy sauce and soap. Editha hopes to continue earning and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, soy sauce and soap.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and resides in Osamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Joelita owns and operates a business raising crops, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. She earns PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Joelita is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Joelita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi is a 77-year-old enterprising businessman. He is married and blessed with seven adult children. He has been running a butchery for the past five months with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Maingi will use the loan to buy bull for slaughtering to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand the business. His hope is to be the main meat distributor around his area, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughtering to add to his business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Nelia and her husband have been running a fishing business for five years. They earn about 4,500 PHP per month with this business. Nelia has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials. She hopes for their business to be progressive. Nelia also desires to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has nine grown-up children.  To earn a living, she runs an electronics shop selling mainly televisions, radios and DVD players.  She has been in the business for five years, and has employed one person to assist her.  Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business thanks to her business management training.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more radios and televisions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more radios and televisions to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is  32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He is the main income provider of his family. He has been working as car blacksmith since 2007. His shop is situated in his town. 

Ali is requesting a loan for $1,200 from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase metA. products needed for his work. He has high hopes for the future of his business and he is certain that the loan will noticeably improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase metal products needed for his work

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхура замужем и любящая мать одного ребенка. Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию, и она сама обеспечивает семью. Она начинала свой бизнес с купли- продажи женской одежды. Постепенно она взяла знание в аренду и открыла свадебный салон, так как в городе круглый год проходят свадьбы и больше спроса. Она сдает свадебные платья на прокат. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и хотела бы получить займ. Она планирует использовать займ для покупки платьев и оборудования для салона.
texts.en:
Mashhura is married and the loving mother of one child. Her husband is away working in Russia, while Mashhura takes care of the family. She began her business by buying and selling women's clothes. Over time, she was able to rent a building and open a bridal store. Weddings happen all year round and her services are in high demand.
She's asking for a loan in order to expand her business. Mashhura plans to purchase new dresses and equipment for her showroom.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and equipment for a showroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock of cereals for sale

loans.name: Stanislas

texts.en:
Stanislas 32 years old and is married with one child, who is 3 years old.  He owns a boutique selling various goods, such as rice, sugar, bottles of water, biscuits etc. He has 4 years' experience. The hours of his business are from 7 am to 8 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Stanislas has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more stock to sell. Stanislas will use profits from the loan to help satisfy his family's basic needs, and to start saving for his future. He also hopes to be able to buy a motorcycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as rice, sugar, bottles of water, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa. a 50-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three children, two of whom are still studying, has been working as a medicine trader since 1992. He has also been a sales agent for a locA. company since 2007.

It is very common in Lebanon to have multiple businesses in order to meet the high costs of living. Even so, life is sometimes very difficult, so today, Mostafa is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his son’s university fees. His only goA. is to ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to pay his son’s university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing and to later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 27-year-old married mother of a six-year-old, has been farming in her home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya for the last years years, with her maize and bean produce going to the local market. She says a lack of adequate rainfall is the main challenge to farming in the area.

Lucy is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase fertilizers for her maize, banana and bean farming. She says they will improve her farming income and help her repay the loan as well as provide her family with basic needs. She is also planning to buy more land to make her farming more commercial. This will be Lucy's second loan from Juhudi Kilimo, having received 20,000 KES previously.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has 10 years of experience working in the agricultural field. In 2006, he started his own business which consists of cultivating vegetables. He has one part-time employee helping him with his labor. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizer, seeds, agricultural equipment, and supplies. The loan will absolutely improve his financial situation and he states that he is in a real need for this. In the future, he plans to open a vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, agricultural equipment, and supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 36 years old and a single mother of two.  She runs a pub to earn a living.  She has four years of experience in the business and has employed two people.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has really grown her business, and wants to thank Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills. Her desire is to expand her business premises so as to accommodate more customers.  She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy crates of soda and beer.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Margen

texts.en:
Margen a 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.  She is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Margen grows corn to sell, which she has been doing for over five years.  She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Margen is requesting her sixth loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for services to increase her crop yield. Margen joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and married to Benson. They have one child. Elizabeth has been operating a boutique for the last three years in Emali town. 
Elizabeth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of shoes and clothes for resale.
In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and buy a plot for setting up business premises.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en:
Khaldoun is a 43-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and five school-aged children. There is no doubt that he has a huge responsibility as the main source of income for his large family. Khaldoun has owned a plot of land in his town since 2008. He cultivates fruits and olives. In parallel, he used to serve in the Lebanese army and is still benefiting from his retirement compensation. 
Today, he is asking to borrow $1,700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase pesticides and tools to prepare the land for crops. In the future, he plans to use advanced farming techniques and methods in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and tools to prepare the land for crops.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is aged 40 and has been in farming for over 20 years. He lives with his family of four children in Murang’a, Central Kenya, where his farm produces tea, milk, poultry, and tomatoes for the local market.
James has made a loan request of 35,000 KES to help him to extend his poultry business by buying more poultry birds. He says the income will assist him in educating his children. James wants to increase his poultry birds to 5,000. He says the main challenge in farming is the high cost of of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a businesswoman who operates an animal sales business from her home. She purchases goats and sheep when they are young, raises them up by giving them food, and then sells them at a profit to butchers and during the season of Eid.
Gloria's husband is an electrician by profession and offers an electrical repair service to his customers. He is an expert in his work and receives a good amount of work every month.
Gloria has two daughters, both of whom are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. She will use the loan to buy sheep and goats in larger numbers, which will allow her to improve her business and profits. Gloria has been operating her business for many years and is very confident of business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 57 years old, married, and has six children.  He sells clothes to earn a living and support his family.  He has employed one person in the business.  He also rents outs some rooms for business purposes to earn extra income, as well as selling old newspapers for recycling.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained knowledge of financial management.  This has helped him to manage his finances by saving, and to invest more in his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.ru:
Агаси (Aghasi) 40 лет, он живет в Ванадзоре вместе со своей женой и несовершеннолетней дочерью. 
Уже четыре года Агаси занимается разведение кур в специально построенном помещении-курятнике во дворе своего дома. Он покупает 2-3 дневных цыплят в Степанаванском инкубаторе, держит их в своем курятнике, откармливает их и сдает в магазины города, а также на птицефабрику. Благодаря доходу от своего бизнеса Агаси содержит свою семью. 
Недавно Агаси отремонтировал курятник и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для настила крыши своего курятника, а также для покупки корма для цыплят.
texts.en: Aghasi is 40 years old and lives in Vanadzor with his wife and young daughter. For four years, Aghasi has been breeding chickens in a specially-built chicken coop in the yard of his house. He buys 2-3 day-old chicks in a incubator in Stepanavan, keeps them in his chicken coop, fattens them and  delivers them to city stores and poultry factories. Thanks to the income from this business, Aghasi provides for his family. Recently Aghasi repaired the chicken coop and now he is requesting a loan of 800,000 drams for roofing his coop and for buying food for the baby chicks.

loans.use: To roof hencoop and to buy feed for his chickens

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: From Kampong Chhnang province, Mrs. Eam, a 55-year-old single woman, is a hardworking farmer. She is in the business of making bamboo baskets besides farming, earning approximately $1.50 per day. Presently, Eam lives with her brother, 30, a local rice cultivator. During this harvesting season, Eam would like to buy stocks of rice at a low cost from local farmers to store in her house and to resell for a profit in the future. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner HKL to use as capital to purchase stocks of rice. In the future, she hopes she will be able to expand her business and improve her  standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice.

loans.name: Hasab

texts.en: Hasab is a 58-year-old Lebanese widow who lives with her three children. After the loss of her husband, Hasab had to double her efforts as she became the main breadwinner of the family. Therefore, for the last 18 years she has been involved in the agricultural field, specializing in cultivating fruits. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She will also use the loan to pay for seasonal employees who help her with the hard slog since she is older now and cannot do the work single-handedly. Hasab estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 12 per cent.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 27-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has one child who is six years old. The child goes to school. 

Jeremiah runs a cigarette store business, and he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Jeremiah heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 to purchase more cigarettes like Sportsman Uganda, Mtk cigarette, Turska, and many others. Jeremiah has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Jeremiah would like to hope for an increment in the business size, to have a good store and not to be selling only cigarettes. 

His major challenges include the competitors in the market with the same type of business store, which leads to a low rate of income.   

Jeremiah says that he is happy for Finance Sudan’s support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 51 years old and has two children. She lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. Nga has a mobile phone shop. She buys and sells new and old mobiles. She has been running this business for five years. Nga has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 
Nga has participated in Kiva partner SEDA since 2007 and has always repaid her loans punctually. This will be her sixth loan from SEDA. She would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more mobiles to resell.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been working as a farmer cultivating vegetables for the past 15 years. With his requested loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to buy new farming supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds, in order to increase his productivity during the coming season. In the future, Ahmad plans to further expand his business and start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Elrose

texts.en:
Elrose is a married woman with two children. She is 23 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Elrose owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn and bananas for resale. She has been earning a living from this business for four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from her business. 
Elrose has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase land to raise additional crops. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC for almost three years. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is 31 years old, married, and has four children aged 2 to 9.  He has owned a business selling cows for two years. The hours of his business are from 7 am to 5 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Deogratias has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cows for resale. Deogratias will use profits from the loan to help satisfy his family's basic needs, and to start saving for his future. He will also hopes to be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 33, married and has four children aged between two and six years old. Moses has been in farming for ten years, mainly producing maize and beans for the local market. He also runs a cereals shop in the market.
Moses has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produced will help to provide milk for his family as well as repay the loan. Moses wants to focus on improving his farming business and producing milk in bulk. He adds that fluctuations in milk prices remain the challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 060201-Hoằng Châu Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 060201-Hoằng Châu solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has one dependent. Phượng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. 
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Phượng is lack of capital. In 2005, Phượng joined Kiva partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 
With her business profit, Phượng hopes to provide for her children, buy land of her own, and be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Abiyemeje /shyr Group

texts.fr:
Vedaste fait partie du groupe Abiyemeje /SHYR. Il a 41 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 6 mois à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4  ans de primaire.

Vedaste est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des haricots, des sorghos et d’autres articles pour les revendre. 

Dans les prochaines années, Vedaste voudrait être le grossiste. Avec les profits, Vedaste prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Vedaste is a member of the Abiyemeje/SHYR group.  He is 41 years old, married, and has two children, aged six months and eight years.  The older one attends school.  He (Vedaste) has had four years of primary education.

Vedaste is a merchant.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his credit to buy beans, sorghum, and other items to sell.

In the years to come, Vedaste would like to be a wholesaler.  With his profits, Vedaste foresees being able to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy beans, sorghum, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional pesticides and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 1 to 16. She sells various products, such as beans, rice, potatoes etc. She has one year of experience in this business. Her business is open from 8 am to 5 pm every day except Sunday.

Betty has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her agriculture practice by cultivating more beans, rice, potatoes etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Betty will save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture practice by cultivating more beans, rice, potatoes etc. to sell.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en: Isaack used his previous loan of  50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chairs and buckets.  This loan really boosted his business and helped him get more customers. He now hopes to become the major distributor of plastic chairs, buckets and basins in his region, and has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more plastic buckets and basins.

loans.use: to buy more plastic buckets and basins.

loans.name: 060202-Hoằng Châu Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 060202-Hoằng Châu solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Yến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. 
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Yến is her lack of capital. In 2005, Yến joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.
With her business profit, Yến hopes to be able to buy a new motorbike, help her business do well, and make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Gener

texts.en:
Gener lives peacefully together with his wife in the village of Roma Norte, Enrile. They are blessed with one child. To make a living, Gener involves himself in rice farming and usually produces a yield twice a year. Harvest season usually falls during the months of April and November. The one-hectare plot of land he has been cultivating for almost ten years was inherited from his parents. Gener goes down to the field early in the morning to ensure the proper growth of his rice seedlings. Last harvest season, he earned about 30,000 PHP. 
Gener is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm. He wants to improve his farming practices to bring in a better yield. In the future, Gener hopes to improve his rice production and save enough money to provide a brighter future for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. 
To make a living, Pacencia operates a fishing business, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Pacencia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and five siblings. He works as a hairdresser serving male customers at their request. His business income is very important as he supports his father. Today, Omar is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a car in order to ease his transport difficulties on his way to customers. In the future, he plans to open his own barber shop.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to ease his transport difficulties on his way to customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a devoted wife. She expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Erlinda has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store and raised hogs for almost seven years. The profits earned from her businesses allow her to pay school fees and allowances for her children. She has three children, all of whom are married and live separately from her. 
Erlinda wants to strengthen her business but has an inadequate fund, so she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. The rest of her loan will be used to sustain her hogs.
In the future, Erlinda aims to have a large store and improve her hog-raising business to earn a higher revenue. She wants to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old, married, and has six children.  She also takes care of seven other dependents. She owns a mill for milling different products which come from her community. She has 5 years’ experience in this business. Her business is open from 7 am to 6 pm every day except Sunday, and she currently employs four people to help her. 

Judith has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her milling operation by purchasing a new mill. With any profit from the loan, she will save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a new mill.

loans.name: Hasan
