John is the facilitator of the Makunda B Group. He takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield harvesting two and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest one bag of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, John will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Makunda B Group will each plant plots of between half and one acre of maize.
The photograph shows eight group members, with the Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 22-year-old man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Ghassan wants to get married soon, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for all of his wedding expenses, such as furniture and appliances for his home. He is requesting a loan from FATEN to help. When Ghassan gets the loan, he will be able to pay for his wedding expenses, and he will be well-prepared for the occasion, thus providing him with better living conditions. Ghassan is the man shown in the photograph.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.ru:
Петр живет в Ивано-Франковске.  Он не женат, но скоро планируется свадьба.  Петр имеет свой бизнес. 
Он занимается ремонтом автомобилей. Качественное обслуживание и постоянные клиенты повлияли на рост бизнеса. Петр надежный и ответственный.  Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода. Цель Петра - развить бизнес так, чтоб доход позволил ему приобрести собственное жилье. Петр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на приобретение оборудования для замены масел и для расширения ассортимента масел.
texts.en:
Peter lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. He's planning to get married soon and owns his own business. 
Peter is an auto mechanic. Consistent clientele and his great customer service have had a beneficial impact on the business. Peter is diligent and responsible. This is his main income source. Peter wants to expand his business and be able to buy his own house with the profits. 
He's asking for a loan of 20,000 grivna's in order to purchase different types of oils and equipment needed for oil changes.

loans.use: to purchase different types of oils and equipment for oil changes.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 31-year-old businessman. He is married with two children, ages eight and six years old. He has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy materials to add to his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be the main distributor of cloth materials around his area.

loans.use: to buy materials to add to his stock

loans.name: Lumicho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lumicho B Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Chrispinus is the facilitator of the Lumicho B Group. He takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Chrispinus had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Chrispinus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Chrispinus will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Lumicho B Group will each plant  between half and 1 acre of maize.
Chrispinus is pictured with his group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zuura's Group

texts.en:
Zuura is the leader of this group. She is 37 and resides in Alabuka, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zuura started to cultivate cotton. She purchased a good sort of seeds and got a good harvest. This year she grew 500kg of cotton. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase fuel, fertilizers and seeds for cultivating more cotton. In the near future Zuura also plans to start growing tobacco and potatoes.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 22 years old and live in Paynesville. She is single and has two children, ages 8 months and 6 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been selling bitter ball and pepper. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball and pepper for her business. She says her main challenge is a goods shortage. Josephine says she started this business by rock crushing and she learned this business from her mother. What she like about her business is that it gives her money to support her home. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball and pepper for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a responsible housewife who planned to have a stable source of income to give her children a bright future. She is 51 and has five adult children. She has owned and managed a variety store in her community for almost three years, earning a profit of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month that she has utilized for her family's daily consumption and for the expenses of their children in school. Despite calamities and competitors in the area, she can still make her business profitable. 

She aimed to increase her product offerings to meet her customers demand, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, noodles, canned goods and soaps to sell in her variety store. She mentioned that she will make more improvements in her business through this loan and hopes that her patience and sacrifices will lead her to reach her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, noodles, canned goods and soaps to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Basharat's Group

texts.en: Basharat is the leader of this group. She is 55. Together with her husband, who works as a bulldozer driver, she has raised a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter studies in a college. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Basharat cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest and reselling livestock, Basharat plans to open a trading place. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Santa Maria De Tobati Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé, están en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, trabajando dentro de un ambiente de compañerismo y ayuda mutua.
Una de las mujeres de este comité es la señora Griselda, quien tiene una peluquería. Ella nos comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que gracias a el tiene lo ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia y para mantener su casa. Tiene una buena clientela ya casi fiel pues siempre van junto a ella.
Ella desea el crédito para abastecer su negocio con los insumos indispensables para su peluquería, como ser: tintes, gel, spray, esmalte para uñas y otros. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le dan la fundación  y kiva.
texts.en:
The women from this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are in the first cycle of the Fundación’s Enterprising Women Program working in a spirit of companionship and mutual support.

One of the women in this committee is Griselda who owns a beauty salon.  She comments that she does well in the business because thanks to it she has the necessary income to help her family and support maintain her household.  She has a good clientele of almost regulars who always come to her.

She wants the loan to stock her business with indispensable supplies for her salon like: hair color, gel, spray, nail polish and others.  She’s very happy with the opportunity the Fundación and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr:
Céline est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 1 enfant âgé de 02 ans. 
Céline travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2004. Elle coiffe, vend des mèches et des produits de beauté pour tout client à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de  difficulté. 
Céline a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des mèches, produits de beauté et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir. 
Dans les prochaines années, Céline voudrait Augmenter le niveau de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Céline is a 29-year-old woman who is married to a welder. She has one child aged 2. She has been a hairdresser since 2004, also selling hair extensions and beauty products from her home. She buys her merchandise in Lomé. She works alone. For the time being, she is not facing any particular difficulties.

Céline is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions, beauty products and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) for resale. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Celine wants to bolster her activity. She intends to use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products and pagnes for resale

loans.name: Dilbarhon's Group

texts.en: Dilbarhon is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a bookkeeper. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and a daughter; all the children are employed. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Dilbarhon opened a grocery store. With the profits gained from the trade, she buys livestock for breeding and fattening. She resells the livestock after fattening, and in this way, she earns additional money for the family budget. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.  
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend du sodabi (boisson alcoolisée faite à base de palmier à huile) et des céréales pour tous clients qu’elle livre. Elle achète les produits dans les villages. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le retard dans les livraisons des commandes. 
Akoua a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du sodabi et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is 42 years old and the mother of 4 children, ranging in age from 22 to 13 years old.  Three of her children attend school. Her husband works as a driver.  

Akoua has been working as a reseller since 1987.  She sells and delivers cereals and Sodabi (a type of alcohol made from palm wine) to various customers.  She buys her products in nearby villages and works alone.  Currently, Akoua's main difficulty is delays in delivering her orders. 

This is the first loan she has requested from WAGES.  This loan will help her buy Sodabi and cereals.  Akoua would like to reinvest in her professional activity. 

In the coming years, Akoua would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that the profits will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy Sodabi and cereals

loans.name: Rabassiburkindi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est la responsable du groupe RABASSIBURKINDI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 4ans. Il ne va pas à l’école d’abord. Elle 1 personne en charge.

Mme vend des condiments depuis 4ans. Elle est la responsable du groupe et c'est elle qui tient les tomates, une autre membre du groupe a levé sa main sur la photo. Salamata s’approvisionne au marché dans un village environnant.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de gombo, une caisse de tomate et un sac de sel.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle a pour ambition d’agrandir son commerce et d’acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Salamata is the leader of the RABASSIBURKINDI Group. She is married and has a four-year old child, who does not attend school yet.   She also supports one additional person.  

Salamata has been selling condiments for four years. She is the group leader, she is holding tomatoes in the photo. Another group member raised her hand for the photo. Salamata buys her merchandise at the market in a nearby village. Her customers are women. 

She wants to buy two bags of okra, a case of tomatoes, and a bag of salt. 

With the profits, she would like to improve her family's living conditions.  Her long-term ambition is to increase the size of her business and to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of okra, a case of tomatoes and a bag of salt.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Luque, 16 mujeres se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo. De esa unión es que surge el grupo llamado mujeres luchadoras, en el cual, las integrantes tienen mucha esperanza de crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. 
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es la señora Mirna, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Por medio de este negocio ella gana el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y también para poder mantener su negocio. Mirna se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora, emprendedora y muy sacrificada. 
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de vinos, whiskys, energizantes y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Luque there are 16 women who joined together to help each other through team work.  They formed a communal bank called "Mujeres Luchadoras" in which they have placed great hope for growth, not only economic but also personal.

One of these "determined women" is Mrs. Mirna who sells all kinds of beverages.  Through her business she has been able to earn enough income to support her family and maintain the business.  Mirna sees herself as a hard-working, determined entrepreneur with much of self-sacrifice.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Paraguay and Kiva to buy wines, whiskeys, energy drinks and other items to stock her business and offer more variety to customers.

loans.use: To buy wine, whiskey, energy drinks and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, eggs, soaps, beverages, toothpastes, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Winnie has a charcoal selling business. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days a week. Winnie sells her products wholesale in a shop. She has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  

The main business challenges for Winnie include seasonality and ever increasing price of charcoal. Her goals are to own a delivery van and to build her own house. Winnie lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she produces maize, beans and vegetables. She has been farming for 10 years and is married with 7 children who are all adults apart from the youngest who is still at school. She, herself, is 60.

Felister has requested a loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for a new venture in poultry farming. She says the business will improve her farming income and enable her to provide the basic needs for her family, especially the last born who is still at school. She intends to keep exotic breeds and be the main supplier of eggs for the local market.

She says fluctuation in prices is the main challenge since costs are at an all time high.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Kuña Joaihu Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Joaihu"se originó a través de promociones  que se realizaron en el barrio de las miembros. Todas las integrantes son amigas y vecinas del mismo barrio. Los objetivos que se propusieron fueron trabajar,  fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. 
La Sra. Elva es la presidenta del grupo, ella trabaja en la venta de bebidas, lo cual le ayuda mucho para mantener a su familia y también en su negocio. Su deseo es aumentar su stock de bebidas y ser más rentable, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de vinos, cervezas, whiskys y demás tipos de bebidas, lo cual le será de gran ayuda. 
Ella nos dice que pondrá el mayor esfuerzo para que su comité salga adelante, y así también podrá ejecutar su plan de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Joaihu" committee was first set up as a result of some promotional work that took place in the members' neighborhood.  All the members of the committee are friends and neighbors from the same neighborhood.  The aims that they set themselves were to work, to encourage a supportive spirit and to reach the top level of the program.

Elva is the group's president.  Her business is selling drinks and this helps her a lot in supporting her family.  She would like to increase her stock of drinks and for her business to be more profitable.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy wine, beer, whiskey and other types of drink.  This will be a big help to her.

Elva tells us that she will put as much effort as she can into helping her committee do well and she will also carry out her work plan.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, whiskey, etc.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 39-year-old married man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. He is the father of six children.
Wael is a blacksmith. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase a new machine.
Wael's aspiration is to improve his family's living conditions through increasing his income.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono is a 29-year-old farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with one child aged one. He has been in farming for 11 years and currently produces milk and tea for the local market.

Rono has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says he will use the income to improve the living standards of his family by providing them with the basic needs they currently lack.

He points at lack of finances as the major challenge for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 1 enfant non scolarisé et agé de 03ans. 
Koffi travaille comme commerçant depuis 2010. Il exploite un cyber café pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir avoir accès à la connexion internet. 
Koffi a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de nouveaux ordinateurs et augmenter le débit de la connexion. Il veut améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is 29 years old and married to a hairdresser. The couple have one child, aged 3, who does not go school.

Koffi has been working as a salesman since 2010. He runs a one-man business, operating a cyber cafe for a wide clientele. His main challenge lies in getting internet access.

Koffi is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy new computers and boost his internet connection speed. He would like to be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new computers

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité surge a partir del contacto de una de las miembros con la fundación, de allí surge el grupo denominado Amanecer, el cual tiene actualmente 14 integrantes y se encuentra en el ciclo numero 6. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras luchadoras y emprendedoras. 
Una de ellas es la señora Adela, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de juguetes, comenta que su negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos de la casa y para la manutención de su familia, pero que a veces tiene sus tiempos malos. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y por ello solicita el crédito, además de eso se acercan las fechas en las que más ventas tiene, que son la época de navidad, año nuevo y reyes. 
Quiere comprar más variedad de juguetes y de esa forma abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues es muy importante para ella y sus amigas
texts.en:
This committee was set up after one of the members made contact with Fundación Paraguaya.  The group called 'Amanecer' (Dawn) was formed.  It currently has 14 members and they are on their sixth loan cycle.  The group's members describe themselves as hard-working and entrepreneurial women. 

One of the group's members is Adela, who sells all types of toys.  She says that her business helps her a lot in covering her household expenses and providing for her family.  However, she sometimes has her bad times.  She would like to continue investing in her business and so is requesting a loan as the season of the year when she makes most sales is approaching (the Christmas, New Year and Three Kings season).

Adela would like to buy a greater variety of toys with which to stock her business.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that they are giving her as it is very important for her and her friends.

loans.use: to buy toys for resale

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
FATOUMATA HABITE AU SUD DU SENEGAL , EGEE DE 40 ANS , ELLE A 3 ANFENTS QUI SONT TOUS A L'ECOLE PRIVEE .UN , ETUDIE AU SOS , ET LES 2 AU COLLEGE SACRE-COEUR D'OU L'AINEE FAIT LA 6em SECONDE .
FATOUMATA AVEC SON COMMERCE ASSURE LA NOURRITURE DE SA FAMILLE ET FRAIS DE SCOLARISATION DES ENFANTS QUI SONT DANS LE PRIVE
FATOUMATA ACHATE DES TISSUS MALIEN THIOUB AUPRSE DE SA COPINE COMMERCANTE ENTRE MALI SENEGAL POUR LES REVENDRE ET PLACER AUPRES DES AUTRES JUSQU'A LA FIN DU MOIS ET AVOIR UN BENEFICE.
DANS LES PROCHAINES ANNEES , FATOUMATA VOUDRAIT DEVELOPPER SON ACTIVITE DEVENIR UNE GRANDE COMMERCANTE , VOYAGER VERS DOUBAIS , MAROC POUR LES ACHATS COMME SON AMIE.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, lives in the south of Senegal, is 40 years old, and has three children who are all in private school.  One studies at SOS and two at the College of the Sacred Heart in their second and sixth year.
Fatoumata pays for the children's private school and food for her family with her small business.
Fatoumata purchases fabrics and her friend trades between Mali and Senegal, reselling and replacing them until the end of the month when she has a profit.
In the coming years, Fatoumata would like to develop her business and become a big-time trader, traveling to Dubai and Morocco to buy her wares like her friend.

loans.use: Buy Fabric

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 32-year-old single woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase accessories for trading purposes. Manal is looking to develop her business and increase her income.
Due to cultural reasons, the photograph shows Manal's brother instead of Manal.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking business-woman aged 36.  She is married and blessed with two children who attend school.  She has been selling cereals to support her family.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  Her business environment is busy and competitive.  In the next five years she wants to expand her business.  She has requested for a loan of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seats for her house.

loans.use: to buy seats for her house.

loans.name: Simma Group

texts.fr:
Mme Dadissa est la représentante du groupe SIMMA. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Tous les 2 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes à sa charge.

Elle vend des chaussures et habits de puis 11ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 30paires de chaussures, complets de pagnes et 05 complets d’habits pour enfants.

Elle veut économiser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et chaussures.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dadissa is the representative of the Simma Group. She is married and the mother of two children who attend school. The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 13. She also looks after two others dependents. 

She has been selling shoes and clothing for 11 years. She buys her merchandise at the Sector 10 market, in the city. Her customers are women. 

Mrs. Dadissa would like to purchase 30 pairs of shoes, some pagnes, and five sets of children’s outfits. She wants to save her profits in order to expand her business. Her goal is to open a shop to sell pagnes and footwear.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes, pagnes, and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado panambi, tiene 12 miembros, las cuales trabajan en forma coordinada y siempre dentro de un ambiente de ayuda mutua. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generan mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma ellas puedan ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Odilia es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de toda clase, es gracias a su esfuerzo y buena atención en dicho negocio que puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir sus gastos. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compran de ella las prendas que vende, además de eso nos dice que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir y es por eso que solicita el crédito.
Desea comprar remeras, pantalones, camisas y otras prendas de verano, las cuales son muy solicitadas en esta época.
texts.en:
This group is called Panambi, made up of 12 members all working in a coordinated manner and in an environment of mutual support. They united in order to generate more income to help their families survive, and are currently on the fourth cycle of the Foundation's female entrepreneurs program.

Odilia is one of the members of Panambi, and she sells all kinds of garments. Thanks to her effort and dedication to her business, she is able to help her family and cover her expenses. Odilia explains that she has a well established customer base who always buy the clothes that she sells, and she receives orders from them which she would like to be able to fulfill - this is why she is requesting this loan. 

Odilia wants to buy knitted tops, shirts, pants and other summer clothes, which are in currently in high demand.

loans.use: to purchase items of clothing for subsequent sale

loans.name: La Obrerita Trabajadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Obrerita Trabajadora” es un comité de 14 mujeres de excelente organización, unidas y trabajadoras; que hacen honor al nombre del comité. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas del mismo barrio. Se reúnen semanalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayudarse unas a otras en su propósito de   mejorar su situación económica.
Una de ellas es la señora Dominga, ella es comerciante, tiene una pequeña librería bien equipada donde vende gran variedad de artículos. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora, luchadora y sacrificada, ya que ella lucha día a día por el sustento de su familia, ya que desea darles lo mejor para que de esa forma ellos no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Ella quiere abastecer su librería y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, libros y demás artículos que son indispensables en su negocio. Esta muy agradecida con la fundación por la nueva oportunidad que les da de acceder a una ayuda económica, pues le servirá mucho en su microempresa.
texts.en:
The group “La Obrerita Trabajadora” is a communal bank of 14 women with excellent organisational skills, united and hardcworking who do honour to the bank's name. These ladies are from the city off Villarrica; they are neighbours and friends from the same neighbourhood. They meet every week to support and help each other improve their economic situation. 

One of the members is Señora Dominga who has a small, well equipped stationary store which sells a large variety of items. She describes herself as an enterprising, hardworking and self-sacrificing woman who struggles on a daily basis to take care of her family, as she wants the best for them so they do not have to endure any kind of hardship.

She wants to stock her stationary store and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, books and other items that are essential for her business. She is very grateful to the Fundacion for the new opportunity it gives to access economic aid, as it will be of great help to her small business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, books and more stationary items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Kitale western Kenya and has been farming for 3 years. She is still single. She produces milk, maize and vegetables for the local market.

Jane has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her dairy business and in turn provide income to buy more dairy cows. She wants to own five dairy cows in the next five years.

She faces the challenge of dairy diseases

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Virgen Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El Comité “ Virgen las Mercedes" es un grupo del Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres D. la Fundación Paraguaya, está conformado por 10 integrantes que viven en el barrio Virgen las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Curuguaty.  Ellas realizan actividades en manera conjunta para poder desarrollarse íntegramente dentro del programa y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una D. las miembros es Dora, ella tiene un copetín (lugar D. venta D. comidas rápidas) bien cargado con mucha variedad D. comestibles. Gracias a este negocio ella obtiene el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. galletitas, golosinas, gaseosas y demás productos para vender en su copetín. Agradece la ayuda que le brinda la fundación para con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ Virgen las Mercedes" is a group that belongs to the Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres D. la Fundación Paraguaya. It consists of 10 members who live in the neighbourhood of the Virgen las Mercedes in the city of Curuguaty. They jointly undertake activities in order to develop fully within the program and help one another.

One of the members is Dora. She has a snack store ( a place that sells fast food) well stocked with a great variety of products. Thanks to this business she makes the money necessary to help her family and cover the daily household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy cookies, candies, soft drinks and other products to sell in her store. She is grateful for the help given her and her business by the Fundacion.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old, married and has two adult children. She is a mixed crop farmer. She has been a farmer for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Margaret will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will open a cereal shop. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Dusmurod

texts.ru: Дусмурод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Он холост. Ему 25 лет. Он живет вместе с родителями. Уже четыре года как он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dusmurod lives in the Gissar region. He is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents. For the last four years he has been selling groceries. Dusmurod would like to take out this loan to purchase additional inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr:
Akofa est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 09 mois.  
Akofa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des bijoux pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Akofa a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux. Elle veut réinvestir son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akofa voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie la famille.
texts.en:
Akofa is a 26-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has two children; one of them is in school. The first-born is five years old, and the last is 9 months old. 

Akofa has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells jewelry to any customer at the market. She purchases her goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is the competition. 

Akofa has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy jewelry. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Cat

texts.en:
Cat is a 56-year-old man who is married and has one daughter. His wife helps to support the family by selling bread every day in the local community. Cat and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Cat runs a store in front of his door. He sells coffee, beverages and a variety of fruit juices. Cat would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income to help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock his store.

loans.name: La Grace Group

texts.fr:
Mme R.Julie Pascaline représente le groupe LA GRACE. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 6ans.2 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon depuis 1an. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de toécin dans un village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 03 cartons de savon local et un carton de savon marque SANTEX.

Ses économies serviront à ouvrir un kiosque. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une alimentation et construire une maison (aider son mari).
texts.en:
R.Julie Pascaline represents the group LA GRACE. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is six. Two of her children go to school and she has three people to support. 

She has been selling soap for a year. She buys supplies at the Toécin market in a nearby village. Her customers are women.

 She wants to buy three boxes of local soap and one box of Santex brand soap. She will use her savings to open a kiosk, and her ambitions are to open a grocery store and build a house (to help her husband).

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of local soap and 1 box of Santex brand soap.

loans.name: Emannuel

texts.en:
Emannuel is a dairy farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he lives with his family of four children, ages 8 to 14. Through his farming, he produces milk that goes to the local market.

Emannuel has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to boost his dairy farming business and hopes to be able to meet his family's basic needs, especially the education of his children, as well as repay  the loan.

Emmanuel says they face high transportation costs due to poor roads in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 38 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband earns a living selling rubber.

Hanh started her own business selling gas in 2001. This business helps her to get a steady income to cover her family's everyday expenses. Hanh would like a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of gas tanks from different suppliers. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks from different suppliers.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 55 and has three adult children. They live happily in a village. She manages a small variety store to generate additional income. She has operated her small business for almost five years and earns a profit of P7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their daily consumption and saves for their future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she still manages her business. Her ambition in life is to make her business grow and give her children a better life.

She wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, candies, canned goods, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to work out her plan and make an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, candies, canned goods, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Margaret has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Margaret sells her products in a shop by means of retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and beans. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and increasing prices of food. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build rental rooms.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general food supplies.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker for a railway company.  

Hong supports her family by operating a general store in front of the door of her home. She sells many kind of products including basic household items, sugar, salt, sauces, plastic kitchen appliances, sim cards for cell phones and personal use items.

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase more products in bulk for the upcoming holiday season. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more products in bulk for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old, married and a father of 5 children living in Hoima, Uganda. 

For 11 years he has been in the carpentry business. He started by being employed by someone but later on saved enough to start his own workshop. Now Jackson faces a challenge of late payments by his clients after his work is completed. He wishes to have a big showroom in the future. Jackson needs a loan to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Edik

texts.ru:
Эдик родился в 1973 году. Он живет в городе Иджеване. Эдик в разводе, но помогает своей бывшей жене воспитывать и содержать детей. 
После службы в Армии, Эдик организовал свой собственный бизнес: продажа женской, мужской, детской одежды, спортивных костюмов, обуви, сумок, канцелярских принадлежностей и игрушек. Он осуществляет торговлю в арендованном помещение недалеко от Иджеванского городского рынка. Товары Эдик приобретает в Ереване, а также привозит из соседних стран. Эдик говорит, что наибольшей спрос приходится на детскую одежду и игрушки, поэтому основной акцент в своей торговле он делает именно та эти товары. А перед началом каждого учебного года он приобретает большие партии канцелярских товаров для продажи. 
Эдику требуется кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения зимних женских и мужских курток и детских комбинезонов.
texts.en:
Edik was born in 1973. He lives in the city of Ijevan. He is divorced but is helping his ex-wife to raise and educate their children. After finishing his service with the army, Edik organized his own business: a store that sells women's, men's and children clothing, exercise gear, shoes, bags, office supplies and toys. His store is located in a rented space in the Ijevan central market. Edik purchases his goods in Yerevan or imports from neighboring countries. Edik thinks that there is a lot of demand for children clothing and toys, so he is focusing his inventory towards these goods. He also purchases large batches of office supplies before the start of each school year.

Edik requires a loan of 1,000,000 dram to purchase a lot of women's and men's jackets and children snow suits.

loans.use: To buy winter outerwear to resell

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Kieu is married and 32 with two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Kieu has been running a cafe for the last six months to support her family. Kieu would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of foods, fruit and furnishings for her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality fruit, foods and furnishings for her cafe.

loans.name: Sizouhoin

texts.fr:
Sizouhoin est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 3 enfants, tous scolarisé. Le premier a 17 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.  
Sizouhoin travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend de l’argile pour tous clients et est ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté principale. 
Sizouhoin a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’argile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sizouhoin voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Sizouhoin is 44 years old. She's married to a security agent, and has three school-attending children. The oldest is 17, the youngest is 7 years old.

Sizouhoin has been working as a reseller since 2005. She sells clay as a traveling saleswoman to any customer. She gets her products in Lomé and works alone. At this time, she doesn't have any specific problems.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy clay. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand it.

She says that with her profits, she intends to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy clay

loans.name: Qui

texts.en:
Qui is 43 years old. Her husband earns an income by selling ducks and chickens. They have two sons and one daughter. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Qui has been running a general store since 2001. She operates the business at home and sells rice, eggs, instant foods and spices. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and products to stock her store and sell to her customers.

She hopes that will help her to get a higher income and give her opportunities to improve her living conditions and better provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy more food and spices to stock her general store.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont deux élèves.Elle tient devant son domicile une cantine dans laquelle elle vend des denrées alimentaires, des légumes et des produits de consommation courante.Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de sa localité auprès des grossistes.Son commerce lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge, d'améliorer l'alimentation de  la famille .Elle sollicite un prêt de 50000f pour acheter du sucre, du savon, des légumes et diverses condiments .Son ambition est d'élargir sa cantine.
texts.en:
Dieynaba is married and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She runs a small shop outside her home, in which she sells groceries, vegetables and staple goods. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers at the local central market. The income from her business allows her to take care of her family's basic needs and improve their diet.

Dieynaba is requesting a loan of 50 000 francs so that she can restock on sugar, soap, vegetables and various condiments. She would eventually like to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock on sugar, soap, vegetables and various condiments.

loans.name: Houlezondi

texts.fr:
Houlezondi est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.  
Houlezondji travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vent des céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté principale. 
Houlezondji a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et de l’huile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Houlezondi voudrait élargir l’activité et ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Houlezondi, age 40, is married to a driver. She has four children, out of which three attend school. The oldest is 16, the youngest is 9 years old.

Houlezondji has been working as reseller since 2006. She sells cereals to any customers at the market. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. At this time, she doesn't have any specific problems.

She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cereals and oil. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand it and open a shop.

She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals and vegetable oil

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Pauline has been selling clothes in Banana, Kiambu town. She is 25 years old and married to Tyson. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add a stock of shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

In future, Pauline hopes to open a boutique for large scale trade.

loans.use: to add a stock of shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married and blessed with two children. One of his children is in school. For the last 2 years, he has been running a welding business where he repairs metal doors and gates to support his family. Previously, he was selling clothes. He has employed two people to assist him in managing the business. Julius is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of 3 children, aged 37-23, living in Hioma, Uganda. She has no other dependents and she is the only income earner in the family. Hence, the responsibility of taking care of the family welfare rests on her.

Florence owns a clothing business and she has been operating it for 4 years now. She started it with limited capital of 500,000 shillings but now she has a capital of 1,000,000 shillings. 

She faces the challenge of having accidents while moving to different markets to vend her clothes, and her dream is to operate from an established premises. Florence needs the loan to rent a shop.

loans.use: to rent a shop for selling her clothes.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de  2 enfants.Elle s'active dans le commerce de vêtements et vend aussi occasionnellement des chaussures.Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et place ses produits auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux ou trois mois.Elle parvient à avoir des revenus assez consistants pour se prendre en charge et s'occuper de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un prêt de 350000f pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures.Son ambition est d'acquérir une boutique au marché central et de fixer ainsi ses clients.
texts.en:
Maguatte is married and the mother of 2 children. She earns a living selling clothes and occasionally shoes. She buys her merchandise in the capital and provides her customers with products that they pay for after 2 or 3 months. She manages to generate an income stable enough to allow her to take care of her children's needs.

Maguatte is requesting a loan of 350 000 francs so that she can restock on fabrics and shoes. She would one day like to buy her own shop in which to serve her customers, in the central market.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Esther has been practicing farming in Limuru town. She is 43 years old and married to Stephen. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to prepare her farm for planting season.

In future, Esther hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to prepare her farm for the planting season.

loans.name: Maniafu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maniafu Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alfred is the facilitator of the Maniafu Group. He takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on quarter of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfred was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on quarter of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Maniafu Group will each plant between quarter and 1 acre of maize.
Alfred is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a determined business woman aged 31. She is single and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last six years, she has been selling clothes to support her family. Esther has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, she plans to manage a wholesale business. Esther dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant.  
Massan travaille comme vendeuse de produits alimentaires depuis 1990. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation pour tous clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Massan a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits à revendre. Elll veut renforcer son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Massan voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Massan is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to a driver of a motorcycle taxi. She has one child. 

Massan has been selling groceries since 1990. She sells groceries to a variety of clients in a local market. She buys the groceries in Lomé. She works alone.

Massan has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy groceries to resell. She wants to strengthen her business.

In the coming years, Massan would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries.

loans.name: Stelamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris is 65 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married and blessed with four adult children. She has been running a retail shop business for the past seven months with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stellamaris will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will add cereals to her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Jose Gabino

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 62 años de edad, está casado desde hace varios años con la señora Claudelina, ellos viven en su casa ubicada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Jose es comerciante desde hace tiempo, tiene un local de venta de prendas para caballeros y artículos varios en el circuito comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación. Se dedica al comercio desde hace más de diez años y tiene mucha clientela en la zona que es un lugar muy concurrido. Gracias a esto el siempre ha podido mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos, cubrir todos los gastos, y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se pudiera presentar.
El señor ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de prendas intimas y artículos varios, los cuales le servirán para abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jose is 62 years old and has been married for several years to Señora Claudelina. They live in their own house located in the city of Encarnación. Señor Jose has been in business for a long time. He has a store selling mens wear and sundries located in the commercial area of the city of Encarnación. He has been doing this work for more than 10 years and has a lot of customers in the area which is a busy one. Thanks to this he has always been able to maintain his home, educate his children, cover all costs and solve any unexpected problems that could arise.

The gentleman has asked for this loan to buy underwear and various items with which to stock his business and meet customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy underwear for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel, foams and other materials needed for making sidecars for   motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Teodora Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Teodora es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, y comenta que tiene un puesto de ventas en una empresa.
Dice que hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comidas,  lo cual le ayuda a contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. Nos comenta que todos sus hijos la ayudan en el trabajo para que de esa forma todo sea más llevadero.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y otros, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que la fundación y Kiva les está brindando.
texts.en:
Teodora is from the city of Encarnación.  She is single and has three children.  She works selling food, and comments that she has a stall in a company.

She says she has been selling food for four years, which helps her to have good customers and income.  All her children help her in the work so that everything is more bearable.

Teodora is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, bread, and other products that are necessary to make the foods she sells.

She is very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation and Kiva are offering them.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, bread, and other products to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of maize cereals to sell.

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy has been operating a nursery and kindergarten school for the last three years in Thogoto, Kikuyu town. She is a 31-year-old single lady.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase school furniture and stationery.

In future, Bancy hopes her school will grow and become the best in the country.

loans.use: to purchase school furniture and stationery.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es de la ciudad de Pilar, el vive en la casa de sus padres a los cuales el ayuda por medio de su trabajo. El se dedica al comercio hace más de 15 años, por lo cual ya tiene bastante experiencia en el ramo. Vende productos argentinos de todo tipo, como ser: colchas, sabanas, frazadas y demás. Comenta que hace 15 años que se dedica a este trabajo, el cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda no solo a él sino también a toda su familia. 
Debido a que le va muy bien, el quiere seguir expandiéndose, y en miras a ello es que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar: sabanas, colchas, edredones y demás para abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
Cuenta con varias operaciones de créditos con la Fundación, y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos is from the city of Pilar.  He lives in his parents' home, and helps them out by means of his work.  He has been working in retailing for more than 15 years, and so has a lot of experience in this trade.  He sells all kinds of Argentine products, such as bedspreads, sheets, blankets and more.  He comments that he's been doing this work for the last 15 years, and it has been a great help not only to him but to his entire family.

Given that things are going very well for him, he wants to continue expanding his business, and in order to do so he is requesting the loan.  He wants to buy sheets, bedspreads, quilts and more to stock up and meet his customers' demand.

He has had several loans through the Foundation, and has demonstrated himself to be a responsible and honest person.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, quilts and more for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a father of 4 between the ages of 13 and 9 years. He lives with his family in Kitale in Western Kenya where he has been carrying out farming for the last 7 years with his produce of maize, milk, eggs and beans supplied to the local market.

Robert has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy as well as insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him produce more milk for family consumption and earn more income from the milk sales to meet other family basic needs.

He laments of the shortage of animal feeds and water in the area during the dry season, which compels farmers to spend much due to high costs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruit to add to his business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 41 years old. She is married to Stanley who is a businessman. She has been running a hotel for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to buy wheat flour, rice and sugar for her hotel. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, rice and sugar for her hotel.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Macodou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de trois enfants dont deux sont des élèves.Il pratique la photographie depuis prés de dix ans et fait en même temps le montage de films de reportage  de cérémonies familiales et de manifestations diverses.Ses activités lui permettent d'obtenir des revenus et de pourvoir aux besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires, sanitaires  de sa famille.Il sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour l'achat de pellicules, de CD et d'autres accessoires.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Macodou is married and the father of 3 children, two of whom go to school. He has worked as a photographer for the past decade, and also makes films of family ceremonies and other special events. He earns enough money to take care of his family´s basic needs, including buying food and clothing, and covering their medical costs.

Macodou is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that he can buy film, CDs and other photography accessories. He eventually aims to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy film, CDs and other photography accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of travel bags and briefcases.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy GNLD detergent products for sale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Editha has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la ciudad de Luque, está integrado por 26 mujeres.Ellas se unieron con mucho entusiasmo, ya que desean por medio del comité mejorar sus ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias e hijos, ya que no quieren que ellos pasen por ningún tipo de necesidad. Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, por lo que les gustaría poder continuar.
Una de ellas es la señora Palmira, ella tiene 47 años, está casada con el Señor Narciso, quien es Carpintero. La Sra Palmira tiene 5 hijos( 3 son Varones, y 2 son Mujeres) están todos estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta e todo tipo de cortes de carne, en lo cual le va muy bien. Gracias a su trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio, quiere comprar cortes de carne, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee, from the city of Luque, is made up of 26 women.  They meet with a lot of enthusiasm as they want, through the committee, to improve their income and thereby help their families and children as they don't want them to have to want for anything.  They are working very happily together and would like to be able to continue.

One of the members of this committee is 47-year-old Palmira who is married to Narcisco, a carpenter.  Palmira has five children (three sons and two daughters) who are all in school.  Her business is selling all types of cuts of meat and it is doing very well.  Thanks to her work, she is able to help her husband with their household expenses.

Palmira is requesting her loan to stock her business.  She would like to buy cuts of meat which will enable her to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat to sell

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with ten children. 
Tarcela has a pig business selling matured and grown pigs. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Tarcela has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Magdalena has a shop that sells used clothing and animal feed by the kilogram for pigs and chickens. She has run this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of used clothing and sacks of animal feed for resale.
Magdalena has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing and sacks of animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Arlen has a shop that sells electronic loads for different networks such as GLOBE and SMART. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads for different networks.
Arlen has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads for different networks.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 20-year-old single man. He has been offering taxi services with his motorbike for the last year in Machakos town. 
Philip was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be Philip's first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to top up his savings to buy another motorbike.
In the future, Philip hopes to expand his business and increase the number of motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 41-year-old married lady, who knits wool to make clothing articles such as scarves, blouses, children’s dresses, etc. At first, she used to make them for friends and relatives whenever they placed an order, but for the last five years she has turned this activity into a profit-making business, and her products have reached customers beyond her relatives and friends, even outside her city.
Now Ibtisam has applied for a loan to buy more wool to make clothing items in order to have sufficient quantities to reach and distribute to more cities. In the future, she want to buy an electric knitting machine, employ two people, and open a small workshop as a small factory.

loans.use: to buy more wool and make more clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for his art business.

loans.name: Rovic

texts.en:
Rovic is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Rovic has a shop that sells and rents DVDs and CDs to customers. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of DVDs to rent out.
Rovic has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of DVDs to rent out.

loans.name: Francis Erick

texts.en:
Francis Erick is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Francis Erick provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay for maintenance.
Francis Erick has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Arlyn provides pedicure and manicure services. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed to provide her services.
Arlyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide her services.

loans.name: Shefaa

texts.en:
Shefaa is a 43-year-old married woman who has eight sons and daughters. She started a small home retail business a few years ago to help her husband and family financially. In the last few years, Shefaa has decided to focus more on her business and has started to think of improving and expanding it. As a result, she has added another item, blankets, to the clothes that she sells.
Shefaa has applied for this loan to buy more of these products at wholesale prices. In the future, she wants to have her own retail store and have another section in it that sells home products, too.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Melanie provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.
Melanie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife, three sons, and one daughter. Since 2008, Omar has owned a poultry farm. He hopes that once he has received this loan, he will be able to buy more chicks for the farm. He believes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: buy more chicks for the farm.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric has been in the transport business in Machakos for the last year. He is 26 years old and married to Mercy. They have been blessed with one child.
Eric was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to add stocks of maize, beans, and vegetables to the greengrocery shop that he runs alongside his transport business.
In the future, Eric hopes to expand his greengrocery business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize, beans, and vegetables to his greengrocery shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with twelve children. He has six dependents and he lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. 
Patrick is a hardworking man who has been operating a bar business for four years. He started it as a small village pub but now he has relocated it to Hoima town. His future goal is to open up another branch in Hoima town. Patrick needs a loan to buy beers, sodas, and other soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and other soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 23-year-old married lady who has a son and a daughter. Since they are still a young, small family, Hanadi decided to start a small retail business at home selling clothes. 
Now Hanadi has applied for a loan to buy more clothes at wholesale prices. She hopes to start a distribution business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Imelda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and vegetables. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and vegetables for resale.
Imelda has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
