Jane is a resident farmer and a mother of four children aged between 2 and 15 years old. She has been in farming for three years with her milk and vegetables supplied to the local market. She says farming has been the only source of livelihood for her entire family.
Jane has made a loan request of 31,200 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. She hopes to raise her family's living standards with gains from her business. She hopes to rise to the level of the major suppliers of dairy products in the area. Like other farmers, she faces animal diseases as the major challenge to her business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 25-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Josephine, a housewife, and they have a four-month-old baby.
Lucas operates a stall from which he sells various home products – for example, torches, radios, CDs and many more items. He has been running this business for the last five years and he makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 
Lucas joined Kiva partner KADET recently and has been awarded with a first loan, which he will use to buy CDs, torches, power extensions, and other items. He will use the profits to expand his business because he hopes to own a big shop selling home products at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of home products.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 32 years old and lives with three family members in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to build her own family house and stop renting.
Dorothy is a daring woman who ventured into the timber business, which is predominantly a business carried out by men. She has been in this business for the past ten years. She started as a sales lady for someone in the timber business, then later on, after learning the trade, she started up her own business. She faces a challenge of high fees levied on her by National Forestry officers. Her dream is to own a big timber shop. Dorothy is requesting a loan to buy more timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila, a 28-year- married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. In business for five years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Cerila hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sood

texts.en: Sood, a 22-year-old single man from Gaza, is a butcher who is requesting this loan to buy all the meat that he needs for his shop. He believes that once he receives this loan he will be able to bring in more customers and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy meat for his shop.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh, a 20-year-old ambitious young man who finished high school, started working and helping at his brother’s shop. At the shop he sells cosmetics, gifts, and accessories. Because he succeeded in what he is doing, his brother now depends a lot on him in the shop. 

Now Sameh wants to work on expanding the business to include selling at wholesale prices and quantities and be a distributor for some of the products, and that’s why he applied for this loan.

In the future after he has gained the experience he seeks, Sameh wants to open his own shop in another area as another branch for their family’s shop.

loans.use: to work on expanding the business to include selling at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella, a resident of Kampala, Uganda, is the married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She takes care of one additional family member, her mother. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the last 10 years Adella has been operating a retail shop seven days a week. She also has a motorcycle that helps her generate income on a daily basis. Facing the major business challenges of transportation and seasonality, Adella is requesting a loan of 2000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap. Her goals are to build rental houses and to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt , boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a mother of two children aged 10 and 4, is a farmer in the area of Nkubu, Central Kenya where for 10 years she has been growing passion fruits, beans, and cabbages, selling to the middlemen within the local market. She laments the high cost of inputs, especially fertilizers and pesticides. She also trades in second-hand shoes and clothes for additional income.

Evangeline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimoso to buy dairy goats. She says dairy goats are a rich source of milk and have become popular in the area. She will use the income to educate her children and improve their overall standards of living.

Evangeline appreciates the loan services offered by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Mary, who operates a hotel in the city, and they have three children.

John runs a mobile phone accessories shop in Kisumu and has been doing this for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy mobile phone chargers, mobile phone spare parts and other phone accessories. 

From the profits, John intends to inject some capital into his wife’s hotel business so as to increase the family income and also pay back his loan. His hope is to own a big mobile accessories shop where he can sell items at wholesale to other small scale traders.

loans.use: To buy stock of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jason has a shop that sells snacks like the native Filipino original binangkal. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Jason has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jason hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of electrical goods for sale.

loans.name: Marianne Frence

texts.en:
Marianne Frence is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Marianne Frence has a karaoke shop that provides videoke where customers pays 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for the electricity for the karaoke services.

Marianne Frence has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marianne Frence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for the karaoke services.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 37 years old and married with two children, living in Hioma, Uganda. He is the only income earner in the family and his dream is to build a permanent residential house. 

He has owned a clothing business for the past 10 years. He started as an employee then later got capital to start his own business. He faces a challenge of the business being seasonal and of defaulters. Ronald wants a loan  to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sharihan

texts.en:
Sharehan, a 26-year-old married lady, is the mother of five sons and daughters. Her husband works a full-time job in the Ministry of Education, and after work he sells used furniture that he collects, but till now his business is still a home-based business. 

For that reason, Sharehan has applied for a loan in order to help her husband to open a small separate store to sell used furniture. From there he can expand in the market.

loans.use: to help her husband to open a small separate store to sell used furniture.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana was born in 1966 and lives in Ijevan city with her school-aged son. Svetlana's daughter is married and she lives separately from her mother.   

Since 2005 Svetlana has run her own shop where she sells food, household goods and clothing. With the profit from her business she keeps her small family, supports her business, and also was able to buy a computer. 

To increase her income, Svetlana intended to manage an Internet Club. Thanks to her first Kiva loan, she was able to buy two more computers. Her son has good computer skills so, after his lessons, he used to help his mother in her new occupation. 

Svetlana says that trading business is more profitable than running an  Internet club, so she decided to close her Internet club and to go on only with her trading business. 

Now Svetlana is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy winter outerwear, household goods and food for her market.

loans.use: To buy winter outerwear, household goods, and food for her market.

loans.name: Veverian

texts.en:
Veverian is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Veverian has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Veverian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a resident farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is married and has four adult children. 

He is 53 and has been in farming for 30 years. His produce is bananas and sweet potatoes for the local market. He also works as a security  guard at the local market.

Wilson has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will use the additional profits to expand his farming by buying dairy goats, poultry and rabbits. He is worried, however, about rampant animal diseases.

He says the loan will bring benefit to his family by uplifting their living standards.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 45-year-old hardworking mother. She started three years ago making sweets and pastries at home and selling based on the orders she gets. To do that, she uses an old oven which she would like to exchange ifor bigger electric one that will make her production easier, and for that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new electric oven.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children and both go to school. She also takes care of  her father. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

She operates a restaurant in her home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and rainy season. Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Elvie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Wilma has a shop that sells fish like mackerel and sardines. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino es chofer asalariado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de La Paz y su esposa es enfermera trabaja en un centro de salud. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Tejada de la Ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Marcelino is a salaried driver who belongs to one the driver unions of La Paz, and his wife is a nurse who works in a health center.  He is requesting a loan for maintenance of his vehicle.  

He lives in his in-laws' home, which is located in the Villa Tejada area in the city of El Alto.  He is married, and has three children.

This is the first time that this client is taking a loan through our institution and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for his vehicle for passenger transportation.

loans.name: Abd Almahdi

texts.en:
Abd Almahdi is a 28-year-old hardworking single man who lives with the rest of his family of 10 members.

Abd Almahdi recently bought coffee making equipment to make Turkish and Arabic coffee and started to make coffee at home, filling it in special containers and distributing it to the coffee shops in the area.

Because he is now getting a lot of requests from new coffee shops, he has applied for a loan in order to buy more equipment and ingredients to make more coffee and sell it to new shops and in that way, expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and ingredients to make more coffee for distribution.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is age 50 and married. He has six children, four adults and two minors, with the latter still schooling. 

He has been in active farming for 24 years. His farm currently produces milk, bananas and mangoes for the local market. He also runs a retail shop dealing in cereals.

Silas made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 25,000 KES to purchase poultry birds and spread his risk from dairy farming, which has been his main source of income. He hopes to earn more income and open up his banana farming for heavy commercial purposes. He says the income will also help him educate his last two children.

Silas says he is challenged by poor rainfalls and markets that offer poor prices for farming outputs. He mentions, however, that Juhudi Kilimo is helping farmers with loans that are processed quickly.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rochell

texts.en:
Rochell is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Rochell has a shop that sells fish like mackerel, sardines and trout. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Rochell has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rochell hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 36-year-old lady, who is married to a non-Jordanian man. Her husband owns a truck for gas bottle distribution to houses and restaurants. 

In order for Linda to help her husband financially, she started a small home-based business selling food and cleaning products. She has now applied for a loan to increase the quantity she has and add more variety to it. In the future she wants to have a small grocery store.

Because Linda is a conservative person, she asked her mother to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To add more variety to the range of products she sells.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: El señor Donato trabaja como chofer asalariado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de La Paz y su esposa se dedica a la confección de centros para señoras de pollera; los mismos son vendidos en una feria que funciona todos los días de la semana en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito sera para el negocio de su esposa ya que adquirirá telas que son su materia prima al por mayor para abaratar costos. Donato y su esposa viven en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Obispo Bosque en la ciudad de La Paz; están casados y tienen tres hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Donato works as a salaried driver and belongs to one of the drivers' unions in La Paz.  His wife works making women's skirts, which she sells at the a market that operates daily in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be for his wife's business, as she will use it to acquire at wholesale the fabric that is her raw material, so as to reduce her costs.

Donato and his wife live in their own home, which is located in the Obispo Bosque area of La Paz city.  They are married with three children.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making women's skirts.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 27 years old and married. She has one child and works very hard to provide for the family.

Ann runs a boutique shop in Kenya and requested a KES 40,000 loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more stock to improve her boutique business.

Ann has been in this business for the past two years and sells clothes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

In the future, Ann would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to improve her boutique business.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Virgenia has a barbershop that provides hair cutting and styling with her husband as the barber-man. She has had this business for 10 years.

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

Virgenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virgenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, and he is 34 years old. He has been in farming for eight years and currently employs one farmhand with the income from his produce of peas, bananas, milk, maize, and beans that he sells to the local market. He runs a cereals shop to get additional income.

Silas has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank at 32,000 KES and irrigation pipes at 8,000 KES. He says the availability of water through the irrigation system will ensure a better and consistent income. He plans to boost his farming by buying two more dairy cows.

He laments the high costs of feed and inadequate rainfall as the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 24-year-old divorced lady, who started 2 years ago selling used clothes.

Wisam buys used clothes from those who want to sell and fix them if needed then re-sells them. She has applied for a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes at a lower price so as to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plates and dishes for resale

loans.name: Jovinille

texts.en: Jovinille is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Jovinille has a public utility van that provides services to the community. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Jovinille has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovinille hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Hong has run a  business of selling lime since 1999. Hong's husband supports the family as a driver for hire and sometimes helps her run her business. 

Hong would like a loan to increase the scale of her business by purchasing more lime in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will increase her income and allow her to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to expand her current business by purchasing lime in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38 years old, single, and has three children. For the past 10 years, she has been a dairy farmer in Limuru, Kenya. 

Ann is requesting a loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a dairy cow.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She has repaid her prior loans on time.

In the future, Ann hopes to practice large scale dairy farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: La señora Janet es ama de casa y su esposo es jubilado rentista. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (arena, estuco, pinturas) ya que se realizara el arreglo y pintado de la fachada de su hogar. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Obrajes  de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada  y  tiene cuatro hijos pero ya están casados. Es la primera vez que Janet aplica para  obtener un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Janet is a housewife, and her husband is a retired property manager.  The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials (sand, stucco, paint), as they are fixing up and painting the facade of their home.

She lives in her own home, which is located in the Obrajes area of La Paz city.  She is married with four children, who are themselves married.

This is the first time that Janet has applied for a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sand, stucco, and paint to fix up and paint the facade of their home.
